description:
Yum!!! I love this Thai place! The dishes are so reasonably priced, you can get an entree under $10 which is so rare in San Francisco. And they're delicious! 

If you like spicy, get it Thai spicy because the mild level is not very spicy at all. When you eat in, they serve the rice in the shape of a heart, which is such a sweet food display in my opinion. 

I like their curries the most, both the red and yellow & gaang dang curries are delicious. I also liked their Tom Kha soup. I wasn't a huge fan of the Pad Broccoli, but that is the only dish I have had that I didn't like. Oh, and there are a ton of vegetarian options. A true neighborhood gem.
author: M P.

description:
This is my go-to Thai restaurant in the neighborhood, and it never disappoints. Last week I had a favorite, Pad Kee Mao with Macaroni (corkscrew pasta) and shrimp. They have 2 versions, and I prefer the second, with egg & tomato. Both versions are good. Other favorites include their Tom Yum soup, green curry, and fish cakes. And yes, occasionally I treat myself to their fried banana with coconut ice cream. 

What I like: clean, good Thai food; friendly service; very reasonable pricing; and a comfortable place to watch the foot traffic on Church Street.
author: Sally S.

description:
This place is such a hidden gem in San Francisco!

For one, the prices are absolutely reasonable compared to the rest of overpriced food and restaurants in the city.

It's a very chill, relaxed vibe with calm music playing in the background. The staff is also quite attentive, albeit a bit aloof. The service was also quick. 

I came here with my family to celebrate my mom's birthday. We all thought the food was amazing and authentic. They have a variety of menu options, and no matter what you order, you are bound to enjoy it.

I forget which curry I ordered, but I ordered the "mild" spicy - and that was too spicy for me. I might just be weak, but it made me wonder what their regular spicy must be like.

I had a great time and I will definitely remember this place the next time I'm in the city and craving Thai food.
author: Merisenda A.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. I've been going there since they were on Monterey Blvd. Great, authentic food and such nice people. Their golden bags appetizer is delicious, and you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. Parking has gotten tougher over the years, but you can always hop on the J. Go!
author: Amy M.

description:
Great place with yummy plates 
If you like
Pad Thai and chicken curry, they are great !
Fried rice are good
And you must try the jasmine tea
author: Jad A.

description:
This place is super close to my house. So I went in around 6 when the place wasn't busy at all. I asked the guy that I need an order to go. He asked me to goto the counter where he will take my order. After waiting for 10 min he came in and took my order. 
My order came sooner than expected. I asked him if the paper bag have chili sauce in it. He said no. I asked him if I can get some. Without saying anything the guy went, came back with two chili sauce containers and slammed it on the table. And I was looking at him like what is going on. The place is not even busy. I wonder how do they treat their customers. 

Let's talk about food now. I ordered pad Thai. It was not good at all. Very dry noodles, it was only 4 small shrimps in it and wasn't good at all. I love any type of Thai food but it was the worst pad Thai I have ever had. And I'm not saying it because the gentleman treated me bad I'm saying it because it's the reality. 

If you love Thai food, I would highly recommended Marnee Thai. It's the best Thai place in Bay Area.
author: Sumbal A.

description:
Regent Thai is a reflection of the quiet Noe Valley neighborhood it resides in. The ambiance is charming and relaxing, with a rose at each table and gentle music playing overhead.

The wife and I came by for lunch and ordered four lunch specials to share:

* Tom Kha Gai ($3.95): chicken coconut milk soup
* Pad Thai ($7.25): stir fried rice stick noodles with egg, tofu, ground peanuts, bean sprouts, and choice of chicken or beef
* Pad See Ew ($7.25): stir fried wide noodles with broccoli, egg, and a choice of chicken, beef or pork
* Kao Pad ($7.25): fried rice with egg, tomatoes, onions, and a choice of chicken, beef or pork

Most of the dishes have vegetarian options. We opted for the vegetarian versions of the Pad See Ew and Kao Pad. The Kao Pad was delicious and was my personal favorite, though I found that the vegetables could've been cooked a little longer. The Pad Thai and Tom Kha Gai were good as well. Unfortunately, the Pad See Ew was a bit too oily.

When I asked for a substitution that I thought was reasonable (cashews in lieu of egg in a vegetarian dish), the waiter agreed to it but didn't tell me that he'd charge $1 extra. When I got the bill and asked about the extra charge, the waiter offered to remove it. Still, some communication upfront would've been nice.

Overall, the quality and portions were reasonable. We managed to finish everything, but we left full. I wouldn't mind coming back again, especially for lunch special pricing!
author: Anson W.

description:
Want authentic Thai food for an amazing price? Regent is the place!!! When I got my check and saw it was only $28 for 3 dishes and a drink, I was shocked. 

You start off with their complimentary fried chips (I think they're rice cakes?). My friend got a refreshing Thai tea and for our meal we split the Thai fresh egg rolls, yellow curry and pad Thai. 

I really enjoyed the fresh egg rolls. They were not fried. The rice cake was so fresh and the perfect texture. My friend wasn't a fan though, she was expecting something fried. 

The curry was the highlight of our night. The spices they used in that curry were perfectly balanced. We  woke up the next day wishing we could have it again for lunch! definitely order this. The brown rice was also shaped in a cute heart!

Pad Thai was pretty standard but delicious!

They had such great service as well. Everyone was so nice and the food came out quick!Definitely will be stopping by here again(:
author: Courtney N.

description:
If you're a Thai food aficionado as I, this place is going to fall short.  I belabored over 3 or 4 stars but went with the higher number because of a few things: menu with lots of interesting items you can't find in many other SF Thai restaurants, including the wonderful, but hard-to-find, Southern Thai dish Mussamun (or Massaman) Curry, and their prices for SF are pretty amazing for a place as this (being almost at the end of Church may be partially why; on the other hand, there are now several high-priced places in this area, so I give Regent full kudos for keeping things low), and a few more things I'll detail below.

The main problem here is that the flavors are not bold enough -- the food preparation is somewhat lacking in passion & soul, so to speak.

The Tom Kha Khai (chicken coconut soup) was just "ok."

Chicken Satay, although nicely presented, was otherwise uninspiring, with slightly greasy chicken and a fairly flavorless peanut sauce.

The Massaman Curry, one of my all-time favorite dishes, Thai or otherwise, was truly lacking in flavor, the beef was a little tough, and it was missing the traditional burnt peanuts within.  But, again, I appreciate that they had it at all.

Good things about this place, besides the aforementioned low prices, is a pleasant interior, very nice staff, albeit a bit harried, extremely quick order-to-arrival -- it's rare I've gotten my food so fast (eating in the restaurant) -- comfortable seating, and they serve rice chips with a sweet sauce as a free meal-starter, extremely rare for a Thai restaurant.

But, unfortunately, this is not a "destination" Thai restaurant, really only good for the folks who live in the neighborhood because it's so convenient.  I much prefer Chili Cha Cha 2 on 24th in the Mission (located not all that far from this one).
author: Merrick W.

description: This is our families go-to Thai joint! Been coming here for years and the food has consistently been great! We get everything from fried egg rolls, Thai fresh veggie rolls, chicken satay, shrimp pad Thai,  beef Pad See Ew, yellow chicken curry, brown & Jasmine rice, to cucumber salad, & fried rice! It's all good! We have both eaten there and called in Togo orders and the service is great either way! We will continue to get food from here whenever we feel like Thai in the city.
author: Kerith H.

description: The highlight of Regent Thai is the prices. But on the other hand you get what you pay for which is kinda bland food. I've had the pad Thai, pad see ew, and yellow curry on multiple occasions and it was just okay. Not bad and not great. The younger waiter who's always there is also kind of snobby has a bad attitude. Regardless of the downfalls of Regent Thai, I'm going to continue coming here because it's super cheap.
author: Brandon M.

description: The Gaeng Garee Gai #21 on the lunch menu, was delicious! The curry was flavorful and tasty, the brown rice went really well with it, and the cucumber salad was yummy as well.
author: Dan B.

description: This place is great! We live right around the corner and order take out all the time. They are quick, prices reasonable, and the flavors are amazing. I love the pad see ew, panang curry, their sweet and sour shrimp soup! Regent Thai does not disappoint!
author: Sarah G.

description: Tried calling 20 times from two different phones to order food on a Sunday night. We got through once...and they out us on hold and never picked the phone back up. Not really sure how you order food from a restaurant that never answers their phone!
author: Jesse Y.

description: I liked.  Flavors were there but my curry sauce dish had hardly any liquid, which made my rice not be able to be accompanied with any juice. I ordered two dishes that had Seafood combinations. My scallops were very rubbery and my calamari was chewy. The service was good. So no complaints there. I was kind of upset that I noticed they had wine once I was getting ready to leave. No one offered me a wine list nor was it on the regular menu. I might have been not so critiquing of my meal if I would have a glass of wine
author: Elease T.

description: You're so lucky if you live by this restaurant! This place seriously offers great service, beautiful dishes, flavorful and tasty dishes that are great price, clean and airy interior and bathroom. I highly recommend it and I will definitely be coming back!!!
author: Habibi T.

description:
My friends and I LOVED this place. Every single dish was tasty as F, and the prices were super reasonable.

We ordered a bunch of things, including the Miang Kham appetizer (an appetizer with dried shrimp, lime, ginger and toasted coconut - a bit bizarre but pretty good!), roasted duck salad, Pad Kee Mao, pumpkin curry, and more. All really good. The menu is huge and they have a bunch of vegetarian items as well.

Definitely one of my top 5 favorite Thai restaurants in the city.
author: Valerie L.

description: I was excited to try Regent Thai Restaurant as they had solid ratings on Yelp. However, I am disappointed to leave a three-star review for many different reasons. The biggest factor has to be the quality of the food. I cannot underscore how mediocre and bland the taste of the two dishes that I tried. The Boneless trout is overwhelming with monotonous sweetness. And the curried pumpkin with vegetables lacks dimensions. I could hardly taste any spices. The service staff was courteous, but they were rushing me at around 9:19 p.m. The restaurant was supposed to be close at 10. The dining room space is not adequately heated. I looked around and most of the customers were still wearing the jackets. I asked one of the wait staff and she explained that one time they forgot to turn off the heater when they closed down the restaurant. The next thing they knew the manager threatened to fire them. So as a result, they turned off the heater early. Overall, it was rather a disappointing experience. No way I am recommending this place to friends and family.
author: Thuy V.

description: The snapper is unique & delicious.  The pad Thai Is tasty.  The shrimp salad has unique veggies. Mint & basil.
author: Denise M.

description: Favorite Thai on the area! The soups are incredibles and the staff is super friendly. Buying food here has become a weekly need!
author: Daniela C.

description: MIANG KHAM. Please folks, if you order this, put the coconut sauce on top and eat the whole leave in one bite. I could eat a plate of these appetizers on my own. Service is a bit slow when we were there. Only two waitresses. There weren't enough high chairs. But food is spot on. I'd come back here again.
author: Marlene T.

description:
Solid Friday night takeout spot but dont expect an authentic Thai flavor. Most of the dishes attempt to be Thai but fall way short. On the up hand, prices are super cheap by San Francisco standards at ~$8 an entree.

Ordered the Pad Kee Mao and while it hit the spot, it didnt satisfy my craving for thai food. It was -just- noodles in sauce. The chicken wings too felt similar; not much meat on it, and while the flavor attempted to act Thai, it was more of some ~*ambiguous*~ 'Asian' flavor. The Golden Bags were adorably presented and I would say the best of the 3 dishes I tried but not great enough to come back here. 

Tips
- solid takeout place!
- order about 20 minutes ahead
- parking is limited right in front but there are neighboring streets where you can try parking

TL;DR
Service (3/5) - prompt & friendly
Food (2.5-3/5) - it is o k 
Ambiance (2/5) - bright lit busy neighborhood spot
Value (3/5) - cheap, but flavor doesnt follow
author: Sara S.

description: Such a great local spot. Definitely try the duck curry and fried rice. I LOVE the larb.
author: Ashley K.

description: I ordered Thai foods togo from Regent Thai and the foods were pretty good even though we skipped the chili to make it not spicy for the little kids. I bet the foods were even better with a hint of chili spice. The price is relatively good for the portion size. Not expensive and not too much foods neither. I loved the pineapple fried rice. Parking is a bit hard around so allow extra time if u come here. Didn't take photos of the foods but will do next time. Will come back again for their delicious foods.
author: Lena H.

description:
Review #1800

4.5 stars rounded up 

Regent Thai really wowed us. They're a corner eatery you might not notice on a quiet stretch of Church Street, but the food makes them a destination restaurant. 

#21 Tom Kha Gai: I've had this coconut milk soup at many Asian eateries, but Regent's tastes superior by far & has a velvety texture that made it difficult to stop eating! Good amount of bamboo shoots, which is one of my favorite Asian ingredients. 

We're fans of chili & garlic so we ordered both chicken (#33 Green Bean Chicken) & shrimp (#63 Gung Pad Kee Mao) with a similar chili garlic paste. Both incredibly delicious, both had a spiciness level that was perfect for us; if you're looking for real heat, ask for "Extra Spicy." 

Another thing to ask for -- four tiny pots of various spices, sauces, & pickled jalapeños -- guaranteed to heighten your eating experience if you're anything like us; we add several condiments to each & every spoonful.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I've been here twice already since my friend recommends this restaurant. It's within walking distance of her home, very convenient for us to grab some dinner nearby.

There were 3 of us, so we ordered family style to share: 
* Tom yum soup: it came in a bowl, divided among us, but it was not as piping hot as I am used to.
* Larb Ped (duck salad): nice seasoning and good duck pieces
* Yellow curry with chicken: smooth sauce and just the right curry flavors
* Brown rice: nice presentation in the shape of a heart

I liked this authentic family owned restaurant and their special sauces is really good.  The blue and white China set is an elegant touch.  The ambiance is cozy and you can definitely have good conversation with your meal.  During Christmas holidays, they have fresh mini trees on each table and lights hung around the windows, quite festive. 

Street parking may be tricky.
author: Linh L.

description: After an afternoon tea at Lovejoy's we chanced upon this Thai gem in Noe Valley.  The decor was nice, the place was clean, and the food was delish!  We had pad thai, green curry, garlic shrimp,  eggplant and tofu, catfish, chicken with basil.  The food came out perfect and the service was great.  Complimentary shrimp chips was also yummy.  Will definitely come back the next time we are in the area.
author: Notsky P.

description: My favorite thai restaurant in the city. Great for eating in or takeout. Staff is friendly and the food is awesome.
author: Serena R.

description: Great food at a great price can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We were seated right away and it was busy, the service was great and food came in a short waiting period. The deserts were also perfect portioned and hit the spot after our meal!
author: Mack L.

description:
This Thai place is okay and definitely didn't wow me. Have been here a couple of times, and I've ordered different items on the menu. Every time, the food portion of the restaurant is pretty small. 

Yesterday I ordered the Regent fried rice. There was only one shrimp, and two very tiny pieces of chicken in it, which was clearly a disappointment. The food itself is okay - definitely not the best that I've ever had. Also, just keep in mind that if you order curry, they charge you additional money for the rice, which is not the case in other Thai restaurants that I've been to in SF. 

The service of the restaurant was good, and there were constant water refills throughout the meal.
author: Jack T.

description:
Decent, but not great. 

This place is no frills -- the exact type of place I like, but it was quite musty smelling, which is a bit of an issue for me bc of potential associated health considerations (& my husband is allergic). 

The service is very quick and to-the-point. 

Unfortunately, we weren't terribly impressed with the food. The PAD KEE MAO & the curry just didnt have very much flavor. 

But a huge plus is that it is VERY reasonably priced.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This post is way overdue. I've been coming to Regent back when they had another 2 locations in SF. They've always welcomed customers like family and their food, like today is full of flavor and made with love. My favorite will always be the double cooked chicken and Regent Trout. The sauces they use on these two dishes give me life. It's got the sweet, slightly sour, not too spicy and saltiness that you crave in a great Thai dish. Now, they only have their Church St.  location and the prices reflect what San Francisco is, but they still have the great warm welcome and the yummy goodness that I first fell in love with in 1998.
author: H M.

description: This is such a great place! I've been here twice and the food is excellent every time. I really recommend their chicken skewers appetizer with the peanut sauce. It's so tasty and I order it every time. Great customer service every time and I never have to wait long to be seated. Their bathroom is always clean and well looked after.
author: Jasmine V.

description: I was really looking forward to trying this place as it's down the block from my new job. Sadly, my chicken pad THAI was very plain. Had very little to no flavoring. I feel like I over paid for plain noodles with chicken....
author: Aida G.

description:
Just had a wonderful Thai dinner. The Pad Thai and Pumpkin Curry were delicious as was the Tom soup, filet salad and green bean chicken. 

The staff is nice and it's a quaint little spot. We'll be back.
author: Angela S.

description: I usually don't give yelp reviews but I felt like this needed to be said. I just walked in a few minutes ago to pick up an order of Pad See Ew. The nice woman working there told me that I could pay for it at the counter. I went to the counter, handed the man working the register the cash and some change (7 pennies to be exact) and he said that they do not take more than five pennies. He rudely said that he was going to "let that go this time but not next time." Money is money, and so what if I only had seven pennies to give him rather than a nickel and two pennies? The only reason why I am giving this place two stars is because the food is good and decently priced. I will not be coming back here if they're going to be that petty about the way that I give change. Do not waste your time or money here.
author: Victoria S.

description: I liked the vibe and feel of the place when I first came to check the place out. Clean surroundings and they got nice decors. The food here was fresh, well presented and flavorful too. The staff here were warm and kind. This is one of the many Thai spots I have added to my list and I am thinking of coming back here soon!
author: Brenda L.

description: Our neighborhood Thai Resto - dependable, a great value, great for takeout! We especially love the duck curry, papaya salad, filet mignon salad, and crispy tofu with crispy basil.
author: Diana R.

description:
Came in with my mom for a late lunch on a weekend and the place looked decently packed, which we took as a good sign. Staff was really slow to take our orders and check, and were not attentive during the meal, but I can overlook that as they were friendly when we did interact with them. Street parking is decent in the area and the neighborhood is great; quiet and peaceful. 

The food really was just A-OK. We had the Tom Kha Gai, Pumpkin Curry, and Gway Tiew Gai Kua. The food was flavorful enough, but didn't stand out as they aren't as authentic as other spots you'll find in the city. Prices are really amazing here though, especially with their lunch specials, which they offer on the weekends as well.

Don't go out of your way for this place, but not a bad place to drop by when you're in this nice neighborhood and hungry.
author: Kristi T.

description:
I've lived in Noe Valley for nearly ten years and this place is consistently great. I love the Golden Bags appetizer  - not only are they tasty but they are cute (can't help it). The Yellow Prawns on the Chef's Special menu are super flavorful and the light frying is perfectly done - I just wish they gave you a couple more. 
Recently tried the Tofu Choo Ros from the Chef's menu and it is also great - light crispy fried cubes of tofu with crispy mustard greens on top (maybe my favorite part). The Gai Regent was superb - the seasoning is similar to the Tofu Choo Ros but the double cooked chicken is so good we didn't even care - with crispy basil on top, as well. 
My boyfriend orders the Kao Pad Regent which is a Thai fried rice and I don't know why I'd never tried it in all these years, but I will be getting it EVERY time moving forward. 
The service is always good and it's super convenient to pick up for takeout. A great neighborhood restaurant.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Honestly, time and time again, I've been thoroughly disappointed with my Regent's experience. I live around the block so I've been at least 3, 4 times. Each time, the portions seem less than satisfying and the food is usually greasy and not what I would consider intricate or of high quality at all. The only redeeming thing is their lunch time prices which are cheaper than dinner but exactly the same thing. 

I wouldn't go out of your way to come here, but if you're in the neighborhood, it's not bad for cheap eats ($7-10).
author: Lucy G.

description: Friendly joint with lovely food and quick service. Open till 10p got my business. Red curry with tofu was great. Tom kha Kai also solid. A few dollars cheaper than some Thai places in town. I'll certainly come back if I'm in the area.
author: David A R.

description: Who says San Francisco is expensive? The valve is extraordinary at Regent Thai. Starting with good quality wines at the lowest prices in San Francisco and continuing through some of the best tasting dishes we have ever had. We always order extra for lunch the next day but we ate all of our order.   Beautiful presentation, the rice came in a heart shape. Carved garnishs and more. Parking is limited so take the MUNI if you can.
author: Art H.

description: The twice cooked duck was dry with a sauce that was too citrusy for the dish. There were also tiny bits of bone in it that made it difficult to eat. The pad kee mao lacked flavor in both the noodles and the pork.
author: Vivian N.

description: This place is just delicious. Nothing special but it's good solid Thai food at a decent Noe Valley price.
author: Rohan D.

description: Can not go wrong, food is great. I have yet to be disappointed! Prices are reasonably.
author: Peter F.

description:
Most definitely THEE BEST THAI SPOT in The City thus far! They never disappoint. I go so often, they know my name, and voice over-the-phone. Lol.

When I ate meat (I'm vegan now), the yellow chicken curry was awesome, and their skews.

Now that I don't eat meat anymore, I love their Panaeng Pak-Pumpkin Curry ( I order mine's Thai Spicy) with brown rice during the lunch special hours.

Also, the Pad Broccoli is bomb too! 


I LOVE THIS THAI SPOT!


NOTE:
Lunch Special is served between 11am-3pm Tuesday-Sunday.

They are now CLOSED ON MONDAYS.
author: Ievrin O.

description:
Honestly, my reviews are almost always focused on the food--I usually excuse bad service when the food is good enough.
And the food was great! My red curry tasted awesome, and was just spicy enough. Free rice puff appetizer, too! Portions were decent, and definitely enough for one person. 

But holy crap service was slow. Two people servicing the entire restaurant at prime dinner time--no way that's going to end well. I think I waited 5 minutes to even be approached when I entered, 15 minutes after being seated and before my order was taken, and over 20 minutes waiting for the check at the end. (Food, however, came very quickly.)

Kind of off-putting that curry doesn't come with any rice--paying an extra $1.50 for a tiny bowl of rice (not enough to actually finish the full curry serving) hurts a bit, regardless of how cheap everything else is.

The servers were very kind despite all the issues, so I might consider giving them a second chance if I ever see it looking a little more empty.
author: Gautam G.

description: My husband and I are regulars and we LOVE Regent Thai! The food is consistently delicious and the service is always wonderful. They have lots of vegetarian options and can also make several dishes vegetarian upon request. We haven't tried any of the meat dishes, so can't speak to those. It's surprisingly reasonable too. Always solid, fresh food. Yum!
author: Ue C.

description: Excellent service. Good prices. Nice atmoshpere. I liked the service. The beef was well cooked. The portions we're good. The fried rolls were worth it
author: Eric M.

description: Just ate here with my friend. I loved the food and the service! Not to mention how quality the food is and at such a good price. There was so much I enjoyed about it - definitely will visit again.
author: Emily H.

description:
Glad to have found this place. I've been here a handful of times already, and will be back for more.

It's super cheap, and delicious. Win, win! My new go to spot for Thai food. Everything is consistently good. The lunch menu are options are limited, but super cheap around $6.25 and fills me up every time.

Love this place.
author: Jessica S.

description:
The food is good but the service is terrible just because they are always short on staff when the place is busy. Expect to never get menus or to get your order taken for 10+ minutes,

I love that the price is super super cheap! And the food is definitely great at that price. I always come here or get take out if I am wanting Thai food and for a good deal.

FYI Their noodles tend to be on the lighter side with not as much gravy
author: Allison S.

description:
Ok, one of my all time favorite Thai restaurants in SF! The golden bags are delicious! My favorite dish is the Regent Gai; can't find anything like that anywhere else. The food and service have always been consistent over the many years I've been coming here. It's a great reason to get out of my neighborhood and head to Noe Valley!

Looking forward to my next visit....which needs to be VERY soon since my mouth is now watering for the Regent Gai! Speeding down the street now - People, move aside, I'm hungry! :-)
author: Rich B.

description: The prices here are great for SF - about $7-10 per dish. I went with a friend and we ordered two dishes and one side of rice and were perfectly full afterward. We both enjoyed the food - we ordered crispy duck and a vegetarian noodle dish. The service was not super warm, but it was fast. We were seated quickly.
author: Lauren C.

description: Came here from yelp saw they had 4 stars so thought I'd swing by on vacation since it's near my Airbnb spot. They couldn't work with me on my order I wanted to substitute if I even offered to pay extra for it and she said she couldn't do it. The service wasn't great either , would not come back here again nor recommend anyone to this place.
author: Rudy A.

description: THIS IS SOME BS. Don't do it. Their pad thai was freezing cold, and the waitress was rude. Don't do it! Save yourself!
author: Laurel C.

description:
Uh-maze-ing. Pumpkin curry, bomb. Tom yum, bomb. Salmon platter, bomb. 

Everything here was surging with wonderful flavors, super kind staff & loved the shrimp chip appetizers. 

The Tom yum - perfect for when you're feeling a little under the weather. 

The coconut flakes and shredded shrimp appetizer was surprisingly pretty good. I was skeptical about order it because it looked too "plain" - some stuff on a piece of spinach? But I was wrong, it was like a Mini Asian taco - semi sweet, salty, crunchy, ginger-y. Yum!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
My coworker and I each got our own dish and got the Golden Bags as our appetizer. The Golden Bags were similar to a samosa, due to the potatoes in it. I thoroughly enjoy it since it was much subtle in the spices and balanced well with the cucumber salad provided.

For my entree, I got the Pad Kee Mao (Chicken). It looks like a lot, but don't be deceived since it's lying on a bed of lettuce. So the portion size isn't fitting for a sitting, leaving me content, not overly stuffed. I got it medium and it was not too spicy.

Pretty solid lunch spot for thai food! And the lunch special menu was top notch if you're trying to eat on a budget. Our whole meal was under $25.00.
author: Vincent L.

description: This place has awesome lunch specials! And probably some of the most authentic tasting Thai food I've had in SF. Bonus: they have brown rice. The decor is basic, but nice. The service is on point.
author: Trena M.

description: This place was highly rated by my Brother-in-Law Jose as he eats there often. Sadly we thought it was ho-hum and will try another Thai place next time. The fresh Spring rolls were in these weird thick wrappers. We ordered the beef with peanut sauce and pork fried rice. Both were kind of on the small side. We'll take Jose for good Thai food the next time he comes up our way.
author: Bruce S.

description: Pad Thai is so so. Tom Kha is my favorite Thai soup but their Tom Kha soup is not as good as what I had  in other Thai restaurant.
author: Danyang W.

description: The food is quite good, but twice now I've been disappointed by terrible service. No water refills (or even the OFFER of refills), even though my mother and I have run dry with our cups. I had finished my water and had to drink my mother's water. I've done my share of waiting tables and would have been ASHAMED to provide this level of service and apologize to my customers for this.  I know lunch is notorious for terrible tips, but I guess this a reason why the shame should go both ways.
author: Lily L.

description: Lunch prices are incredible. Food is real taste with attention to detailed presentation, ingredients, and service. One of my hidden gem spots.
author: Michael M.

description: Came here with my cousins and all of us were extremely happy with the food. This may have become my favorite Thai place in the city. They actually made my pad see ew spicy which is rare to find in sf. I wish they had more of a variety of vegetables in the pad see ew rather than just broccoli and carrots but it was still good. The golden bags were great as well as the cucumber and vinegar salad that came with it. My cousin got a great, refreshing soup too. Great options for vegetarians!
author: Lelyn C.

description: Food was alright. Definitely not the best Thai food. The reason I wasn't such a fan was because it was extremely oily. We ordered Beef Pad ke Mao &a Beef Basil Beef. Food came extremely fast which was kind of weird as well.
author: Shanzay H.

description: It's  been awhile since I've been here. Let's  just say its still delicious! I usually order the same thing when I'm  here and the quality is still good. This time i ordered something different for dessert, sticky rice with coconut ice cream. It is hella good, the rice is sweet sticky with a buttery undertone. Definitely gonna order that again when i come back.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
This is the only Thai restaurant that A and I can agree on, so when she says she wants Thai food...she might as well say "Regent Thai" to save me the trouble of naming a dozen other restaurants.

We usually split the pad thai and egg rolls....and I feverishly munch on the complimentary shrimp chips they serve us.

Is this my favorite thai restaurant? No.

Is it okay? Yes.

The green curry is decent, but not as flavorful as I would like.

I do like their shrimp chips (obviously) and their appetizers. 

Their service is hit or miss depending on how busy they are.

Solid okay food.
author: Jack R.

description:
We found this place while walking around Noe Valley during a visit to the city.

Charming little, busy place! We waited a few minutes before being seated but the service was incredibly quick. My husband and I were quite hungry after a long day and the food and service were both excellent.

We got the veg golden bags, green Papaya salad, cup of veggie Tom Kha soup abd pad khee Mao noodles with tofu and veggies for the two of us. The portions were a little small so we weren't really feeling full (which in hindsight is a good thing) atthe end. But everything tasted really good, so we were satisfied:) 

Will surely visit again if in the area:)
author: Harini R.

description:
Another visit, this time for dinner. Feeling like embracing MY vision of the arch-typical Thai meal: 

THE FOOD:

TOM YUM GUNG - Spicy and sour prawns soup with mushrooms, tomatoes and lemon grass

The soup was unbearably salty. The mushrooms were the (American) white cap cut in half and floating in the brine - come on Regent at least use brown crimini's to avoid that American Midwest sheen. Dinner companion suggested we send it back. Knowing the likely outcome of "we have never had this complaint" or taking it back to the kitchen and pouring more water into the bowl, we ate some of the floating mushrooms & shrimp, which made a  -salty- appetizer.

SOM TUM - Shredded green papaya w/ dried shrimp, carrots, tomatoes, ground peanuts/lime juice dressing

Odd. With the papaya salad within the bounds of a proper rendition, it was on top of a nest of plain lettuce. The "salad on a salad" redundancy was an affront to the papaya salad. Peanuts were not ground, they were peanut halves, which oddly I am really happy with since I can grab them with my chopsticks. 

PAD THAI - Rice stick noodles with egg, tofu, ground peanuts, bean sprouts with shrimp (thatle be a $1 uplift)

Itsan ok rendition. Tofu fried a few days before serving (not fresh). It struck me that even the mall joint Coriander Thai (IN THE METREON COMPLEX) serves up a better version. 

THE SERVICE:

At most, 1/3 of the tables were occupied. The server ladies dressed in embroidered Thai looking dresses seemed to be plentiful. Getting their attention required a large gesture of a long duration. They were having fun, joking with each other while standing near the kitchen. Felt like we were messing up their evening of cavorting. We are not demanding diners, but events like getting the "check" shouldn't take the exertion of over 100 calories. 

UNRELATED DRIVEL - Observing fellow diners:

Observing fellow diners which are in close proximity is sometimes interesting, and usually unavoidable. A middle aged man with a late teen boy a couple of tables away. The boy with a -fashion- baseball cap, and the man with his smart phone. Didn't seem like much discussion was taking place -silence-. Boy leaves, goes toward the back where the restrooms are. Man pays the bill. A few minutes go by. Man is wondering where boy is, and goes back to the restroom, pounds on the door and audibly "what are you doing? sleeping?". They leave in silence. So, we are left to wonder was this a father and rebellious son? or, a May-December relationship heading the way of the dinosaur (extinct)?. We will never know, but did provide a live, high drama show which was worth the price of admission at a mediocre restaurant.
author: Matsuo U.

description: This is one of my favorite thai food restaurants in the city. I think I've just about had everything on their menu. I've been to Thailand so I can honestly say that it is very close if not, just about as authentic as you can get. Everything I've had here has been delicious. Service is also great; the waitresses are all very nice and pleasant, and what I love the most about them is their traditional thai attire, makes me feel I'm in a restaurant in Thailand! Ambiance is great, gets very full on the weekends, but they are very fast at bringing food so the wait is minimal. Their portions are moderate, but that's me wishing I have more food to eat! I lost count of how many times I've been and I don't plan on stopping.
author: Nita C.

description:
Regent Thai is a cozy restaurant in Noe Valley.  The food is good and very reasonably priced. Apple, the waitress I met was very warm and friendly. 
The owner is a kind person who on hot days bring the crossing guard bottled water.    Regent Thai is a real very pleasant place.
author: Liz B.

description: Such yummy food!! And such a sweet delivery woman. This is my go-to when I'm feeling sick or want to spice up my dinner! The coconut soup is so yummy and always hits the spot. Definitely going back.
author: S B.

description: Swung by with two of my buddies, this place doesn't not work with you. They don't substitute anything & the "noddles" had no flavor. Was very unsatisfied, although the meat was tasty.
author: Rigo V.

description:
Regent Thai is my all time family favorite Thai restaurant! We've had many lunches, dinners, birthday celebrations here! This place is extra special since my fiancé proposed to me outside their beautiful window and we had our engagement dinner right after! So the whole Regent Thai family was in on it!  

Regent has the most awesome, friendly and courteous staff. They are always there to serve, refill waters/teas and provide the check in a very timely manner even on their busiest days! The place is very clean and nicely set up with always a new and fresh floral piece on the tables! 

Now on to the food! I love how their food is not greasy or heavy. The portions are just right. Favorite go-tos are the Papaya Salad, Shrimp Pad Thai, Chicken Yellow Curry and Pad Se-Eiw! The Golden Bags are the best! They are yams and veggies in a fried rice paper wrapper! They are so good! Make sure you let them cool down before you eat! Also the Chef Special Yellow Prawns are so delicious! Must have's for sure!
author: Christine R.

description: Ordered takeout from here. The Pad Ke Maw (w/ pork) had 3 little pieces of pork! And 7 pieces of chopped, old, stinky, moldy "Thai chilies". Also no napkins, silverware (expectation was a plastic fork), no hot sauce. They don't take care of their neighborhood folks, very distressing and pathetic service!
author: Sean S.

description: I got the fried rice with tofu and my sister got the Pad Thai with tofu and I thought the rice was good but not amazing the Pad Thai was pretty good tho! The hospitality was very nice too.  I liked the atmosphere of the place and it wasn't too expensive either our total came out to $20.01 !
author: Cynthia R.

description: Servers here are very friendly. Food is good and compared to other Thai restaurants around the area, it's pretty cheap. Pad thai and other pad are around $6 for lunch. Recommend!
author: Minh H.

description: We are fortunate that this is our neighborhood Thai restaurant, as the food and service has been reliably great over the past 3+ years we've been going!  We eat there or get takeout at least 2x per month.  We love the tofu choo roos, yellow and green veggie curries, pad thai, the coconut soup (vegetarian), and the golden bags.  Everything is flavorful and nicely prepared, food always comes out fast even when they're really busy, and the servers are efficient and friendly.
author: K V.

description: I have gone twice to this restaurant and i have not been disappointed. I say pick any dish in their menu and i am sure you will love it. They have an attentive staff, and the food comes out fast and delish!
author: francisco a.

description: This place has a relatively tall ceiling for a smallish looking exterior. The menu was rather large. The iced tea was creamy and the tea flavour was good. The prawn chips appetizer was crispy as expected and it came with a sweet dipping sauce. As for the main dish, the gung hae chao wang features very large pieces of shrimp with - crispy coating. The amazing part was that even though there was curry on top of the shrimp, it was still crispy. There were not as many pieces of veges as I expected. The noodles were on the soft side, just the way I like them but not too mushy. Overall the plate had good presentation. There was some pieces of hidden raw cabbage at the side. Overall, it was a delicious meal and the prices was quite reasonable.
author: James S.

description:
This is a great place to both go as well as to arrange for takeouts.

I like their soup which hasn't changed
In the years I have been going.

The chicken is cut to a fashion where
It's easy to probe and eat with just a fork.
author: Alexander M.

description: Love this place. Come here at least once a week to try something new. Haven't been disappointed once.  It's a great neighborhood gem.
author: Lester C.

description: I ordered Pad See Ew, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Stuffed Chicken wings today. All food were exceptionally better than I expected! I had pretty decent services! Overall 5 stars!
author: Davis Y.

description:
The Yellow Chicken Curry is THE benchmark for which I judge all others! Yes, yes, yes... I confess, that's a really boring Thai entree, but Regent Thai has been doing it for over 12 years and they're extremely consistent! A very hard thing to acheive in the restaurant world. Their Golden Bags are also perfect! In fact, we've been known to get nothing but appetizers here! 

A great neighborhood Thai place that probably gets overlooked by many. 

Sidenote: probably the CLEANEST restaurant I've ever encountered.
author: Dorje T.

description:
Have to admit Regent That is not my favorite Thai place around & I don't frequent there very often - their dishes contain way too much fish sauce & the times I've asked for them to leave it out, they said they did but I still smelled it in there

Other nearby Thai places who offer to leave the fish sauce out, do it, so I know it's possible.....

Sis likes this place a lot & a visiting Vegas buddy thoroughly enjoyed her meal as well so maybe I was last there on an off night & it's sticking in my memory....

Last order of Pad Thai for me - fish sauce apparent.....after a few bites to confirm my suspicions, gave the rest away.  Sis is a fan of their Pad Thai as well so she had double & wasn't sad about that at all

Vegas buddy - Pad Woonsen Gra Pow - silver noodles w/ steamed tofu & veggies in a spicy chili sauce.  She asked for it to be super spicy & wasn't disappointed - which is saying something b/c she can handle the heat like I've never seen so if something is good on her spicy meter, I say props to you!

So knowing friends & family like this place a lot, I'll err on the side of A-OK.  I'm definitely willing to give them another shot but would ask if someone requests no fish sauce or shrimp paste, please either advise it's not possible or make it happen... 'cause you're not fooling me
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and it is a totally solid neighborhood Thai spot.  FWIW I think this place is actually run by Thai owners (not all that common in my experience).  I came to that conclusion b/c the first time we came here, my husband greeted the hostess in Thai (we honeymooned there) and they seemed completely delighted by that! And the waitresses wear traditional Thai outfits.

The food: super tasty!  We've gotten the som tum each time we've been and it is very good.  Nice and spicy.  I usually get curry dishes here and they are always satisfying (and definitely spicy).  I'm always too scared to ask for anything beyond medium spicy, but medium is definitely a good level of spice.

There's a duck red curry if I remember correctly that is SO good, I really should just always get that, it's fantastic.  The Tom Ka Gai is delicious as well.  This is the problem, I always want to get everything!

I ordered the Thai Iced Tea with condensed milk last time since we went for lunch (caffeine and me don't mix after about 4pm) and it was lovely, but EXTREMELY sweet.  Granted, that's kind of the point of thai iced tea, but be forewarned, it is basically dessert in a glass.
author: Rachel S.

description: very rude staff. food was 4/10 small portions, chicken curry had a sour spoiled taste to it. 0 stars please train your servers, from the minute I walked in the servers were rude,
author: Mike B.

description:
Whenever we get the craving for Thai we order from Regents (take out). Our experiences are consistent. We're always satisfied with our orders, our belly full and they're extremely easy on the wallet. Most dishes are relatively cheap priced under $10 - including meat dishes. 

They're incredibly vegetarian friendly with most dishes having a vegetarian option. Our usual is the green veggie curry and a Pad Thai. The green curry (Gaeng Khiew Warn Gai) has great flavors with a nice medley of veggies. Even if we request mild it's still somewhat spicy but I love it. We typically get this with rice. The Pad Thai although fairly basic, fulfills the cravings. Zero complaints. 

We do have a Thai restaurant nearby but prefer to drive to the other side of Noe for Regent. Is this the BEST Thai restaurant in SF? Perhaps not but I do think it's one of the better ones.
author: Esther A.

description:
5 stars I really enjoy the food from here since I moved to San Francisco 15 years ago. 

1 star for ever 3 years. wow. delicious fried rice. I also enjoy the pumpkin curry and the pad thai 


would go again
author: Tristan A.

description:
This little neighborhood spot elevates Thai food to a whole new level! Everything I ate there was good, but a few dishes were truly exquisite. 

The deep fried "golden bags" are crispy yet light, filled with a fluffy mix of vegetables that tasted slightly sweet with a hint of curry. 

Also tried the yellow curry with chicken. It was delicate and really delicious, perfectly seasoned. The eggplant and tofu dish is my aunt's favorite, though it seemed simplistic next to the more complex curry. 

The really stand out dish was the "Pla Sam Ros", crispy fried snapper in a chili garlic sauce on a bed of tempura-like green beans with a garnish of fried basil leaves. Yep, triple fried and such a treat. 

All of this wonderful food is presented in a pretty little restaurant with high ceilings. The decoration is low key but includes large displays of fresh flowers. The waitresses look charming in their traditional Thai dresses. And they are charming! The service is friendly and attentive. 

Prices are low. We ate well for under $20 a person for dinner including an alcoholic beverage.
author: Heather F.

description: This is our favorite takeout thai restaurant near us. We always get the golden bags. Pumpkin curry is good too
author: Emily S.

description:
Cheap affordable delicious and kid-friendly Thai joint in my neighborhood. I have come here at least 20-30 times and for sure will continue to do so! The lunch is unreasonably cheap --- like $6! And it's just a tad smaller portion and more limited menu than dinner.

My husband always gets the red duck curry (#29). I either go with the regent fried rice, green curry with chicken, ginger salmon, or pad kee mao. But seriously everything here is tasty! It may not be fancy pants like les ros Thai but it's got all your Thai essentials covered. Parking on evenings around this area can be a little tricky. There is never a crowd for lunch and dinner is only crowded on Friday night. 

I wouldn't say this is a place you should go out of your way to dine, but if you happen to be around and crave some good Thai, come here!!!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: This place was wonderful! Great location, clean and nice staff. Food came out fast and was delicious. Will definitely be back!!
author: Alexa M.

description:
Solid really GOOD Thai food. Soups are perfect get a large to go and it will go few lunches with rice....the basil chicken, pad Thai and BBQ my fave for flavor  and  best service of Thai food in SF
Been to  many others and this one is perfect every time. I never feel I am compromising to eat here... yes there are other "cooler" more "exotic" spots for Thai but they do not hit the spot Regent does.
author: Roxanne Y.

description:
So lucky to have Regent Thai as our go-to neighborhood Thai spot! 

- Food is tasty while also healthy feeling
- Lunch specials are very good value
- Takeout is fast; food is usually ready within 10 min
- Ambiance is pleasant inside and welcoming to babies
author: Jamay L.

description:
One of the best Thai places I've tried in San Francisco!

While you're pondering your order, a complimentary basket of shrimp crackers shows up for dipping in a sweet dark red sauce.

The pad see ew had a nice "wok flavor" to it, and was nicely seasoned. The big thing that sets it apart from other Thai joints is that they bothered to marinate their meat before cooking it. No big chunks of flavorless white meat here. The green curry was also excellent, and the rice comes in the shape of a big fluffy carby heart.

Ample space, so I can't imagine a big wait here for dinner.
author: Kevin L.

description:
It's one the best Thai food in this area and very reasonably priced. We had red and green curry. They had the perfect balance of flavors and spices.

Second time we had golden bags for appetizers and they were tasty!
author: Garima K.

description:
One complaint THEY NEED MORE PEOPLE HELPING THE WAITRESSES AND WAITER...There is a moment that all the servers are stressed because they can not give any more...
Excellent food but service is stressed. They don't even smile...
author: Colomba C.

description:
Fantastic find by my boyfriend! He took me here on my birthday earlier this month and we had a wonderful experience! 

Small-ish seating area, with low lighting(nice for dining, not too low as if to hide dirt). It was packed when we entered the restaurant, always a great sign, and good thing we had a reservation. It took a long time for our food to come out, I'm assuming because it was so busy. We ordered an appetizer, the Thai fresh egg rolls, SO delicious! Very different, they are egg roll wrappers but not fried! An experience to be had. 

He ordered the basil beef, and I ordered the red curry with chicken(not as spicy for me, I have stomach issues). I wanted beef, but I got up to use the restroom and had my boyfriend order for me and he mixed them up. We also got a side of rice to share. 
When our dishes came out, I was impressed. The food had great flavor and was VERY satisfying!

We skipped out on dessert because I wanted to find another place with a wider range. I would most definitely come back again!
author: Jordan G.

description: Everything we tried was super tasty! We ordered 4 entrees and a couple appetizers to share and it was perfect for four adults and a toddler.
author: Allison V.

description:
I came here for dinner on a Friday evening with a party of five and did not have too much trouble getting a table. 

We all shared the Golden Boy. Despite all of the rave in the reviews, my friends and I were not too impressed. The taste was really subtle, and no flavor a really stood out.

For my entree, I had the pad see ew. It was average. I prefer my pad see ew a bit on the sweet side, whereas Regent's pad see ew's flavor was too light for me to taste.
author: Jeff M.

description:
My wife and I love this place - we're lucky to have it close to where we live. It's always the one place we'll always agree on when we know neither of us want to cook, but and getting hungry... and cranky. :)

Favorites are the Gai Regent (double cooked crispy chicken, sauteed with fresh chili and garlic, topped with crispy sweet basil), the Gair Him Ma Parn (sauteed chicken with cashew nuts, onions and crispy chili), along with their Thai fresh egg rolls.

Very nice owner and staff make this place a joy.
author: Ches W.

description:
Sub par! I was mislead by the high positive reviews. 

Very disappointing Thai. Not typical authentic Thai made by Thai chefs. Not even average. 

Sorry,  better to try Pad Thai on Mission.
author: Bartholomew H.

description:
I want to give this place a higher rating but the service was so awful! 

My bf and I were going to grab a glass of wine at Noeteca last night but got distracted by how full this restaurant was on a Monday night so we just came here instead. Of course my fat ass would take a full dinner over a glass of wine any day. 

It took us forever to get seated. We seriously stood there for ages eating their candy before they noticed us and finally sat us down. They brought us shrimp chips and put the empty order sheet on our table but never gave us menus wtf! So there goes another 10 minutes when they come back and ask what we want to order and we let them know we weren't given menus and she gave us the most passive apology ever. I also didn't have all the flatware at my table. The water was always refilled though so that is a plus. 

We ordered pumpkin curry with prawns (didn't see it on the menu so just ask), brown rice, vegetarian tom kha, and their scallop and shrimp w/ eggplant dish (#57). Everything was really good! Especially the seafood dish and the pumpkin curry is packed with pumpkin! Omnomnom. One thing I did not like is their tofu. I only like soft tofu without that fried skin and their tofu is fried. 

Their stuffed pumpkin dessert looked really good but I was so full we just went to bi-rite after and grabbed some honey lavender ice cream and cookies to eat back home.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Just got take out today. I eat a lot of Thai food and this really failed to impress me in both quality and quantity. Me and my fiancee ordered Gung Pad Kee Mao and KAO PAD. The Kao Pad (a fried rice) had huge chunks of tomatoes and cucumber?? A huge tomato that was diced in to four pieces.  Anyway, It tasted bland & incredibly boring. The Gung Pad Kee Mao had some flavour of garlic and don't remember any bamboo shoots in there. But the portion size was smaller than a side order. I would say it was equivalent to a side order of white rice that you pay $1.50. Not worth the $20 for the two.
author: Naren R.

description:
On a whim, ordered Regent Thai through Postmates and was very pleased! We had the chicken pineapple curry, and the basil chicken. 
The curry was AWESOME, I may say it's one of the best curries I have ever had, but was a little skim on the chicken.

The basil chicken was good, nothing to write home about. I think we sacrificed a little crispiness by ordering delivery. 

Overall very satisfied and will order or take in  at Regent Thai again.
author: Lili C.

description: I visit my friend who lives around the corner. I always pass by this restaurant and wonder about it, so last night after picking up my friend, I decided to pick something up to-go. I got the chicken pad see ew. It was delicious and I would come back to this nice Thai restaurant again to try other dishes.
author: Denise C.

description:
Had the chicken green curry which was more than half cucumber and peas - we found some chicken too.
The twice baked crispy chicken was really twice baked soggy vinegar chicken.
Totally rubbish, use to really like the food here.  What a Shame.
author: Peter R.

description: Not my favorite but the husband loves the spicy beef with green beans.  So I endure.  I could see the appeal if we lived in the neighborhood and walked here but it's definitely not a destination.  It's no better or worse quality than all the other Thai places within a 1 mile radius.
author: Stanley J.

description:
Best Thai food, hands down. 

I recently visited Regent Thai with my friends and we absolutely loved it. Regent Thai is located in a nice, quiet neighbouhood in Noe Valley. Parking was pretty hard only because it was very residential. As you enter the restaurant, you notice the beautiful ambienace of the place. So simple, bright, and cheerful. The restaurant honestly has a great vibe to it in general.

I ordered a Thai Iced Tea, and the Green Bean Chicken. My friends ordered the Vegetable Curry and Pad Thai. The Vegetable Curry came out first. We each tried a small sample of it, and I absolutely loved it. I could never be a vegetarian just because meat tastes too good to give up, but boy, were these vegetables good! Best Vegetable Curry I have had in a LONG time. The Pad Thai came out next, and it was mediocre. Tasted like any other Pad Thai. Then, my Green Bean Chicken finally came out of the kitchen. Warm, steamy, and fresh, I took a bite. AMAZING! Had just the right amount of spice and went very well with the steamed rice and Thai Iced Tea. 

So to sum it all up, the food was well priced and the quantity of it was enough to be full. Regent Thai gets my award for the most flavorful Thai food. The quality was fresh and the ambiance was nice.

I will be back!
author: Emmanuella Z.

description: This is a solid option for Thai food if you're in the area. The portions are generous and the food is not overly greasy. Their lunch specials are reasonably priced and the atmosphere is very pleasant. The only annoying thing is they don't offer free refills on fountain drinks, which is a bit of a rip off. I'll definitely be back!
author: Diana G.

description:
There phone never works, which kind of defeats the purpose of take out. I've called multiple times on multiple nights where I just get busy signals or a dead line. 

There golden bags are delicious though. The rest of the food was pretty meh. Ordered the pad thai and it just didn't taste very good.
author: Sarah D.

description: I am impressed with food, decor and service! The pumpkin paneng curry was so good! Loved my  brown rice!
author: Jen H.

description:
I came here after work with a friend to get some basic Thai food and we were not disappointed. We had the following:

Chicken Satay
Beef curry
Pad Thai Noodles

Everything was solid. Not the best but definitely made with care. The service was not that attentive but effective in the end. Lots of locals picking up take out orders with only a few folks eating inside. Maybe because it was a Monday. In any case, this a good spot to satisfy your Thai food cravings.
author: Art O.

description:
My take-out Thai restaurant just because it's near home, consistently good dishes, and fairly inexpensive.

Tip: use the side door for take-out, so you're not walking through the dinning area.
author: Leland H.

description: Terrible customer service, the entire staff is unaware of your presence during the entire meal. Not only did we not get checked on once after our food came (we sat for an hour and we're ready to leave for 20), once the lady finally came from the back she stared at us and gave a blank "you done?" Well, yeah I'm done with this restaurant. 1 extra star for fair prices.
author: Ramz A.

description:
So I'm giving this place 4 stars because I love their friendly staff and their chicken yellow curry! It's just a basic yellow curry that I can always count on to taste good and the portions are good too!

However, my boyfriend does not like this place because he says their dishes lack flavor. 

I say, give it a taste and try it for yourself! Every time I go in their it's busy so they must be doing something right!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Winner, winner, chicken dinner! Find delicious Thai - and equally delicious prices - at this airy Noe Valley restaurant.

Before noon Sundays, Regent is practically empty, but fills up quick. They're open every day, and offer lunch specials every day, including weekends. Specials are exactly that: most plates are only priced $4 to $5. (We shared three entrees, two soups, two appetizers, and a dessert for $40!)

Except for a watery tom yum, their cooking holds its own. For starters, the golden bags surprised me with their sweet potato-like filling and cucumber salad. A green curry hit the spot, with good chunks of chicken. Their stir-fried pad macaroni (!) kee mao made me smile, as did a beautifully-presented appetizer (menu item #7) with lemon rind. If you need more spice, just ask for hot sauce.
author: Dave L.

description: I ordered to go. The pad see ew had no flavor. The chicken curry was meh.  I'm not sure if it was the food... Or just me but 2 hours later I threw up everything.
author: Ann L.

description: After eating here since it opened over a decade ago I just cannot accept the RUDE wait staff anymore. I ate here 2 days ago and my blood pressure is still high from a very close knockdown argument with the RUDE women in there. Good bye and time to find another Thai restaurant.
author: Carlo P.

description:
The food is usually very tasty.  I like the curries and duck over spinach.  The servers, particularly Apple are friendly. Glad they have brown rice 

Sometimes the quality of the basic ingredients are n't the best.  But you get what you pay for, and their prices are reasonable
author: Sheila F.

description: Good local Thai place in Noe Valley
author: Kris F.

description: By far the best Thai in Noe Valley (esp after the closure of Swatdee a while back).   The staff is great and the food delicious.  We typically do take out, which is made super convenient via a little side door on 29th st.
author: John S.

description: Love this neighborhood hole in the wall! The only downer was a language issue and not being able to understand the waitress so I couldn't feel confident in my allergens not being present in the food. But it was delicious and fun to do family style. Unique dishes different from the standard Thai restaurant.
author: Kt H.

description:
This is my go-to Thai restaurant in the neighborhood, and I'm absolutely obsessed with it. I normally order take out (call in & food is generally ready in less than 20min), but do dine in every now and then. 

The food isn't too oily, it tastes fresh, and it has good flavor. Our usual order is tofu pad Thai, spicy eggplant, and pineapple fried rice. We also love the vegetarian Thai fresh egg rolls and golden bags as appetizers. Their Thai iced tea is also perfectly brewed.

Overall, service is fast and friendly. Can't go wrong!
author: Ruth R.

description:
Unbeatable prices, food, and service!

 This place is located right by my work and I have to admit at times I find myself drooling when I think about their Nuer Ta Krai (minced beef w/ onions, garlic, chili and sliced green beans in a lemon grass sauce), Chicken Gaeng Dang (spicy red coconut curry w/ bamboo shoots & sweet basil), or Chicken Pad Kee Mao (flat noodles, w/ veggies, chili, and basil).

Nom Nom Nom! All three dishes are de-lish and well prepared. 

I LOVE Regent Thai :)
author: Desiree B.

description:
I have been eating here since it opened a couple of decades ago.  The food has been consistently good, fresh and nicely presented.  Their lunch specials are good deals.  It's my favorite neighborhood Thai place.  I have always had excellent service whether eating in or take out.

My lunch favorite is the eggplant/tofu stir fry with brown rice.  In cold weather, it's the red or green curry with brown rice.  They use the fragrant Thai rice.
author: B.J. W.

description: I came here in the afternoon for lunch. They weren't busy at all. The waitresses looked uninterested and bored. They basically ignored my table the whole time, never made eye contact, and didn't say anything whenever we asked them a question. Food was okay, not very memorable. Portions were tiny. The only thing I remember is the tom kha soup which tasted good, but it only had bamboo shoots. That was disappointing...
author: Monica C.

description: It's a very solid neighborhood Thai restaurant.   to name a few dishes, I've had the chicken satay,  green and yellow curry, chicken basil, chicken cashew, fried spring rolls -- all of which were good.  The thai fresh egg rolls not as good.  The ambiance is very casual/neighborhood place that you can pop in without any pre-planning.  Good for take out. Affordable.
author: Frank D.

description:
I love Thai food. I've been trying out every Thai restaurant in the area, one by one, and this was the first one good enough to get me to make a Yelp account. 

The golden bags are--as others have mentioned--delicious. Little fried bags of yummy veggies with a tasty sauce for dipping. 

Their noodles, meat, and vegetables are all the perfect texture. The service was perfect, I asked for some spicy sauce and was brought a plate of four different kinds to choose from, served in hand-painted china. The server was attentive, without being intrusive. 

The decor is relaxing and unpretentious, the food is excellent and inexpensive. Five stars, give these people your business.
author: Augustine T.

description:
The best service is offered here.  They are kind and friendly.  Their prices are GREAT!  You get authentic Thai food that tastes amazing for such reasonable prices.  I really appreciate this restaurant and enjoy coming back here every time I dine with them. 

My wife and daughter are huge fans.  

My wallet is too.
author: Zane W.

description:
Thai's probably my favorite cuisine.

Needless to say, when I moved a year ago, I was thrilled to find out I would be living next door to Regent Thai.

As soon as I realized this, I yelped the place begging the gods for at least 4 stars. My prayers were answered and I couldn't wait to try it.

Is this the best Thai restaurant I've been to? No. But do I still come here at least once a month because the food is descent, the staff is very pleasant and it takes me less than 45 seconds to get here? Yes.
author: Teiki K.

description:
Pretty good dinner tonight at Regent Thai. We had the Golden Bags to start, and the veggie red curry and Pad Kee Mao also veggie. Great selection of veggie options, most of the menu that you could imagine having veggie, was listed as veggie. Another plus - we like it hot, and always go for "Thai hot" to overcome the local aversion to really making it hot. This normally translates to lots of chilli powder, but at Regent it was lots of fresh chillies. 

It was pretty busy at first, and the service was a but marginal, but food was good - reasonable price too. Couldn't understand other comments on portion size, we had more than enough.
author: Stuart J.

description: Good food for a decent price and the wait staff are always very nice.
author: Judith D.

description: Best neighborhood Thai restaurant in SF. Love the tofu choo ros and custard dessert! This is my go-to when I want a peaceful and delicious lunch/dinner without a huge price tag. The staff is always friendly and remembers what we like, which is a huge plus too!
author: tura s.

description:
Regent Thai is my go-to Thai restaurant in San Francisco. I've tried several dishes but am completely predictable and now stick with their Pad Thai. 

Rice dishes are also good. The Golden Bags are good too, but not a must-have. What I like most, is if you as for extra vegetables, they don't skimp! You get a nice healthy portion of all sorts of veggies.

Lunch is a deal, and you really won't spend more than $15 per person.
author: Megan V.

description:
If you are vegetarian, this is the Thai place for you. Typically the vegetables in a soup or curry are pretty limited in quantity, quality, and variety. Not so here. The vegetable curries (I love the panang most) are packed with lots of different kinds of truly delicious veggies, not just a few baby corns and green beans floating around chunks of tofu.

The service and decor here are really nice, and it's a gem of the neighborhood. Excellent prices.
author: Sophi S.

description: Super good Thai. The coconut chicken soup is a classic. The roast duck is amazing. Food comes out very fast and the staff is very friendly and respectful. I wish the portions were bigger that's the only thing! But the quality makes up for it without a doubt.
author: Aljosha N.

description: I'm rating this place based on customer service. I've been coming here for over 6 years and the service has gone really bad. Two of the staff, the male server and female server never smile, never greet you, never says good bye. They look like they hated their job and when you ask them  for something, they don't acknowledge you. The only lady who's been really nice is the server who's on a fairer side. Other than that, if you don't care about the servers who frowns at you, the food is still ok.
author: Topsy C.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. I love their yellow chicken curry, and if you eat in the restaurant the rice portions is heart shaped. A great ambiance and food!
author: Bailey A.

description:
Regent Thai is one of my absolute favorite places in Noe Valley. It's great for both dinner and lunch, and it's so cheap considering how amazingly good the food is.
 
I've had several things on the menu but I almost always get the golden bags (crispy on the outside, soft and flavorful on the inside) as well as number 31, gaegg garee gai, which is a yellow curry. I usually get the vegetarian version since the vegetables are always perfectly cooked and it's on the healthier side. 
If you're eating in, their plating is always great since the rice comes in fun shapes like hearts and stars. Entrees also come with a small cucumber salad which I devour every time.
author: Cara K.

description:
As a traveller staying in Noe Valley and visiting the Bay Area for the first time, this gem of a place was a great find thanks to the loverly reviews of Yelp. And I must say, I agree with all of their reviews.

This place offers delicious authentic Thai dishes at a fair prices.  Service was amazing, and the portion sizes are more generous than most. 

They also have a take out door and booth area for those picking up their meals.

We had the stuffed chicken wings, double cooked duck, red curry with beef, and of course pad thai.  All delicious and all highly recommended.  The Thai iced tea with condensed milk was also nice touch to our meal is it brought down some of the spiciness of our meal.
author: Stella Y.

description:
Great find!
Found it by accident- tried to go to sustainable sushi place for lunch (was closed)

Best Thai I've had in a long time!!  Fish cakes, hot and sour soup, green papaya salad, pad thai, green curry , and the brown rice
I wasn't expecting much finding this place on accident
Fish cakes comparable to crab cakes- the cucumber peanut sauce went so well with it
Soup was delightful!
pad thai- I know often generic- but something fresher about this one- just yum
salad was so fresh- the flavors very complimentary
green curry very good (could have been spicier though)
the rice!  Brown rice, but I'm not a big rice connoisseur but this was a fancy delectable brown rice- 

It got really really busy for lunch- only 2 waitresses (in gorgeous thai dress)  were like dancers how they always kept water glasses full, etc!  amazing service!!!  It was very very busy! 
This is gonna sound silly- but I asked for to go boxes- curry and rice in one, the rest they could blend together
hours later for dinner- EVERYTHING was individually boxed (in compostable containers) even the sauce for the fish cakes-  leftovers were almost as good as being there- appreciate they cared about preserving leftovers! Very thoughtful and appreciated!
Really fresh ingredients, everything cooked perfectly, great service- and I was SHOCKED at how inexpensive it was!!!!! (compared to thai osha and zaab in my hood  which really suck in comparison to this place)
Will be back!   Kinda of don't wan't to post a review ( don't want it to get too popular) - it was such a great find!
author: Karen H.

description: This was the worst Thai food I have ever had sadly. The curry was the only dish we ordered that had flavor. The Pad Kee Mao had huge jalapeño peppers in it not chopped up at all and besides that no flavor. The shrimp were small and mealy (4) in the whole order. We ordered the Thai Fresh Egg Roll and the sauce was so gross and the roll just fell apart. The crab on top was so dry-- just ridiculous to even charge anyone for it. Normally don't believe in bad reviews but we tried it since it had so many stars and were shocked. Don't waste your time!!
author: Sheryl W.

description:
The dishes were very good.  We shared the chicken satay as a starter.  The cucumber salad that it came with was refreshing and the white rice was served in the shape of a heart.
I had the Guay Tiew Gai Kua (stir fried wide noodles with crispy chicken, egg, and vegetables)
It was so flavorful and delicious.  This was not a spicy dish.
My dining companion ordered the Pad Se-Eiw (stir fried wide noodles with soy sauce, broccoli, egg and pork.  It was also offered with chicken, beef or shrimp)
This too was a very flavorful dish- yet not a spicy one either.
Service was excellent and the restaurant itself is very clean.
author: Thomas D.

description: This place is honestly the best deal and best Thai food... they them for lunch. The service is the amazing.
author: Ollie A.

description:
When in Thailand this summer my brother expressed jealousy over my planned trip to San Francisco because the food in America is really good, therefore it was ironic that the first meal I had in SF was Thai.

As I had real Thai food to compare it with, I can safely give Regent Thai the five stars. The food I ordered was just as good if not better than in Thailand as there wasn't the associated hassle of being in Thailand. The prices are cheap and the portion sizes generous, I'd definitely like to go back to Regent Thai in future.
author: Matt B.

description:
Seriously can't believe I haven't written this review sooner! 

This is San Francisco's best kept secret Thai place! Nothing beats the personalized service from a family run business, the prices are so affordable, and the food is AMAZING! I've brought so many friends from SF, and out of town guests here- NOBODY has ever been disappointed with their food! I've been coming for the past 3 years since I moved to SF, and I get pretty much the same thing EVERY TIME because it's THAT GOOD! 
My favorite of all time, always makes me feel good is the Vegetable Coconut soup!
author: Nicole A.

description:
Regent Thai is located at a quaint corner in Noe Valley and it sure does embrace the neighborhood feel that many of stores in this area have. 
The dining room is spacious enough, very clean and well-decorated. I love the fact that all the waitress wear traditional Thai costume.
I'm always skeptical when trying Thai restaurants since I'm spoiled by a friend's family., but Regent Thai definitely made me happy. 
We had:
-Stuffed Chicken Wings: 5/5
-Tom Yum Kung soup: 5/5
-#7 appetizer: very interesting combination of texture and flavor: 4..5/5
-Pad Thai: 3/5
Regent Thai is above average because food is hearty and well-balanced, unlike many other Thai restaurants that tend to be heavy on the herb/spices and the sweets.
Only the Pad Thai wasn't very satisfying because they use the very tiny vermicelli noodle instead of the stick rice noodle.
Having said that, I would come again if I ever have a craving for Thai food and my other favorite Thai place is closed
author: Alan T.

description:
We had few choices to go to last night and we picked Regent Thai! You know why? Haha that rhymes, because it's the best Thai food I've ever tasted. Period!

This is the place to be if you're looking for a great restaurant to dine in and would like to try something new and different that has out-of-this-world-flavory food...you go here!

For appetizers, we ordered #9 on the menu (Thai Fresh Egg Rolls); you can have the option to get the vegetarian style but we decided not to. SO FREAKIN' DELICIOUS!!! My mouth was watering the whole time and it's going to my "favorite black book list of deliciously-goodness-gracious-food!" Haha!

So, we couldn't' wait to try other foods on the menu - so we decided to order #53, MOO PRIK KHING (Sliced pork sauteed with spicy ginger paste, green beans and snow peas). And #55, PAD PHOH TEAK (Combination seafood sauteed with fresh garlic, lemon grass, green beans, zucchini, sweet basil and flavorful spicy chili paste). Then to top it all off we decided to order Thai Iced Tea to quench our thirst!

It was the best meal, spicy yet tasty! Definitely coming back here again!
author: Jackie A.

description: I've only been here for take-out, but wish I liked this place more. Their pad thai is super fishy, and I wasn't blown away by the ginger salmon or pineapple fried rice. The pad see eew with chicken is very good though, but for some reason they don't use the typical wide noodles. One hit out of four ain't great, but it's the only thai place on the block and I'm lazy, so I'll be back.
author: Josh L.

description: Food was good, not great. They add a lot of unnecessary vegetables to the plate. There aren't many Thai choices nearby. The restaurant was packed. I'd go back. It's in a nice neighborhood area of Noe Valley.
author: David H.

description: The food is always very good and the service is fantastic. This ranks as on the top of my list for thai food in the city.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Delicious red and green curry.  Good level of spiceyness.
The service was a little weird... They tried to take our rice away?
author: Sarah C.

description: Had lunch here last week & it was just OK.  Had a vegetarian dish with tofu & it was almost inedible (the tofu was very tough & chewy, over-cooked).  The other dish we ordered was supposed to be medium-spicy, but was medium (yes, spiciness is subjective, so we'll give them that).  The service was mediocre.  Nothing was terrible, but it was just not exciting like good Thai should be.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
