Meh, food was mixed, service was bad. Coconut soup was pretty good, but not enough lemongrass flavor. Had no vegetables added, just chicken and shoots. Portion was very small considering the large order price. I liked that they had a kid plate, but the water cup had no lid - eek! Green curry and Pad See Ew was good. When we asked for to-go containers and the check while we were still eating, they didn't want to bring them to the table. When I said we were still eating a little but needed to go and could just take care of it, they brought me 2 tiny containers. I used the small one for the soup and asked for a bigger one for the green curry and rice. Was brought another small container and when I tried to fit in the curry and rice it squeezed out all over the table. Very inconvenient to have to eat more just to fit into container when we needed to leave to get our kid to bed! Why are they hoarding their plastic containers? I have no idea. Why does it take 15 minutes to get a bill when only 3 tables have people? No idea.

So many better places to eat at, I can't say I'll be back to this one...
author: SL B.

description:
Regent Thai serves delicious Thai food with heart!  Recently ordered large trays of pad thai, pad se-eiw, and red curry chicken.  5 stars across the board for:
- Punctuality:  I requested my food to be ready for pick-up at 6pm, and it was indeed ready -- piping hot!  This restaurant has their operations down -- from the kitchen to the front staff.
- Tastiness:  Fresh ingredients, beef that was cooked perfectly, crisp vegetables, and the list goes on...
- Attention to detail:  The lemons and carrots were beautifully sliced and scored; the bean sprouts were placed in a corner where they remained crunchy; basil leaves were placed in a separate container so they wouldn't get soggy...
- Friendliness:  Even amidst a very busy restaurant, everyone was friendly and kind.

Though I have been a long-time customer of Regent Thai, I do not make that known when I place orders -- my point:  they treat everyone with the same thoughtfulness and kindness.  Thank you, everyone at Regent Thai!
author: Bay Area Explorer X.

description:
Sweet and spicy, hot or cold, this menu gives you the whole palette of Indonesian, Thai delicacies. I have sampled everything from satay to their red snapper smothered in sweet, spicy chilies. The fish literally melts in your mouth and their version of the traditional peanut sauce is "right-on".  My father grew up in this part of the world, knew the real flavors, and passed this on to all his children. And Regent Thai got it right! This restaurant captures the exotic in the cooking, the menu offerings and in their outstanding service. Easy parking options off of  their Church street location and just a block from the J-line Church St/30St. stop. My first choice for authentic, tasteful Thai food, calming, bright interior design, and excellent service. 
Check out the super lunch specials....the rice plates are my favorite!!!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I would love to give this place five stars, but alas, I cannot.

The food is great, and it is easy for me to get to from Pacifica, and has easy parking, but that's not enough. The last two times I have been here for dinner the service has been abysmal - we were ignored practically the entire time! It took forever for our order to be taken and the food came fairly quickly, but then they took forever bringing out check - rarely checking on us at all. I will have to think twice before coming back here...
author: Kara E.

description:
Went as a group of 4 and we decided to each get 4 dishes and split them. We got the Pad Thai with chicken which was my favorite of them all. SO good!! WIsh I could have had more. Then we also got the crab/pork stuffed BBQ prawns which were good but nothing spectacular. We also got a broccoli dish which was tasty but didnt do too much for me. Finally, we ordered a shrimp curry dish but my boyfriend and I do not like curry so we left that to the other two who enjoyed it. Oh, and we also got the fried spring roll appetizer which was really really good.

In all having had  some appetizer and a little bit of 3 other dishes, I was left hungry which was a little disappointing, but probably not the restaurants fault. Next time I would just order my own dish (pad thai!!)
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Amazing flavor and service. Fresh food and wonderful menu makes it so easy to order, don't forget they will customize any order you would like to your liking(+). When visiting San Fransico is a must stop restaurant.
Check it out and experience some of the most amazing Thai spots you will ever visit.
author: Eli G.

description:
Review #1100! 

One of my favorite Thai places to go to. I think it even trumps Shana Thai down in Mountain View. Hubster and I discovered this place a few months ago and since then, I've gotten take out from here to take back down the Peninsula when I have after work events up in SF.

The service we've gotten has consistently been really good and the food has been delicious.

Golden bags - everyone on Yelp recommended it. The filling was strangely sweet. The wonton wrapper was crispy and I liked the side of cucumbers. I couldn't get over the cloying sweetness. Not a fan.

Duck curry - OMG... SOOOO good. A lot of Thai places offer duck curry but the duck is bland and mediocre. It tastes like the duck was seasoned in peking duck seasoning before being turned into red curry. Best part is that the dish is studded generously with pineapples. Coconut. Pineapples. Duck. I'm in heaven.

Ped gra prow - Stir fried boneless duck with basil, bell peppers, and chili. MMMMmmm... Delicious! Again.. the duck was superb... *drool* This dish plus the duck curry = heaven times two.

Pad Thai - Pad thai here was done really well. The portions were a bit on the small side when I eat with Hubster but when I shared with Jenn W. it was perfect. They have little chunks of tofu in there that she loved. Flavors were balanced perfectly with the savory, sweet, slight tang and topped with the crunch of bean sprouts and peanuts.

Pad Kee Mao - Pad thai won over Pad Kee Mao. I wasn't severely impressed since it didn't blow the Pad Kee Mao from Shana Thai out of the water. It was still delicious but wasn't outstanding.

MMM... I just need to get another excuse to come up here to pig out. The prices are extremely generous for the quality and food you get. The portions aren't HUGE but are reasonable. Service is great, we walked in two seconds before they were about the close and still served us... after I pleaded and begged and promised that we would scarf our food down really fast.
author: Vicky L.

description: The best Thai place I've been to in ages!!! I love it here, the prices and the food are both amazing. I come here once or twice a week and leave consistently happy! This is by far one of the best values in the City.
author: Mr. K.

description: Me with a many friends and and we like this food here very delicious and economical to so you should try this place you'll come back many times and have a satisfy stomach(:V)
author: Anthony V.

description: Solid take out Thai food. We pick up from here maybe once every other month or so. Usually get one curry and one noodle dish. The portions are smallish for the price... My husband and I have to order 3 dishes if we want to have leftovers. It's convenient and fast. Nothing mind blowing but good when we don't feel like cooking. Also note that the spring rolls are strange. Not what I typically think of for Thai spring rolls.
author: Rachel R.

description:
revised to 3 stars. A very good cheap lunch place with specials as low as $5.25.

Not the most authentic or best tasting but very reasonable prices and above average food makes this place very popular
author: Zk K.

description:
I've been coming here for years!  It's not near my house, so when I do go, it's always such a treat.  The staff is friendly, the place is clean, the food is delicious. 

My only criticism is their pad thai is a bit dry. 
But I know that my preference is really saucey, so perhaps their pad thai is standard. 

I always get the coconut soup, the chicken and vegetable mix with silver noodles and garlic sauce, and the nuer sadet (sp?) ground beef dish, tomato base with veggies.  My mouth is watering!

They seem to always be busy! That's a good sign!
author: G W.

description:
Good thai, cheap prices. Variable spicy meter, use the same vegetables in most items.

The yum: golden bags, green curry, red curry, all soups, all noodles.

Good service, for both dining and take out. Never any problems with ordering. Attentive service. Good quality thai food for cheap. Lunch specials are a small portion for a smaller price.

I've found when I order the same dish spicy or thai spicy, the actual level varies.

Good vegetarian options, but be prepared to have the same vegetables in all your dishes, unless otherwise noted.
author: Ouroboros B.

description:
So yum!! Came here with a very large group, and the food and service were great.  Here's what we had:

fried spring rolls
golden bags (think tiny samosa purses)
papaya salad
gaeng garee gai (chicken in mild yellow curry)
moo yang (marinated pork with sweet & sour sauce)
pad thai (of course!)
double cook roast duck (a must-order!)
thai iced tea and coffee
coconut ice cream and fried banana
sweet sticky rice and mango

Everything was soooooo good!
author: Claudine D.

description:
Definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in Noe Valley.  Easy to dine in or take-out, great quality food, good service, and very affordable.  It's one of those quiet comfortable restaurants that you can go every evening without getting tired of the food.  And it's not over-priced like those "fusion" thai restaurants. Just good solid thai food.

My favorite dishes here are the eggplant tofu dish, Pad Thai, and the red curry with chicken.
author: Michael C.

description:
OMG we loved it. Came because of all the favorable Yelp reviews & were not disappointed. We were staying in Noe Valley & walked here and the walked off our meal. However, I would have driven here from anywhere remotely close in the city. We literally could have ordered everything on the menu but then someone would have had to call 911 to cart us away!

Note that we arrived later than the dinner rish hour so were able to be seated immediately. Since the place is relatively small I would imagine that there could be a good wait at peak times, which would give you plenty of time to ooh & aah over the dishes being carried to every table.

Spring Rolls, Pad Thai, Chicken Green Curry, and Prik Khing were enough to satisfy the two of us and yet left us wanting more. Wish we had come with more folks so we could have split more dishes! Will definitely return on my next trip back to the city.
author: Julie S.

description: I was really looking forward to Regent Thai when I first moved to the area.  Very disappointed.  The flavors are so boring and the spice is so mild that I understand now why it's packed with the families of Noe Valley.  Maybe if I tell them that I'm not from the neighborhood then they'll add the spice and flavors. Sad.
author: Janelle F.

description: Great food for the price. BUT they really need to clean the restaurant, menus, windows, etc. We had to sit through our meal while looking at the deteriorating,filthy back of a hanging picture.
author: Noe D.

description: Calling in an order, the staff was patient, kind, and willing to answer some quick questions I had about the menu in a good manner. Second time having it, I haven't experienced a sit down meal with this restaurant but according to the meal I had to-go, I thought it was fair in price. I really liked the duck special and the chicken satay salad. I wish the duck dish was a little bit more in portion size but I can't complain due to the combination of texture and taste. In terms of taste I would say I a nice delightful to-go experience.
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
OMG....Best ever Gung Hae Chad Wang..Prawns, curry,coconut milk ,noodles and veggies
Also GREAT Salmon with curry and  coconut milk
author: J D.

description:
I had a serious craving for Thai food the other night, it had been building up for a few days. My craving for curry and the curiosity of going to a new spot brought me to Regent Thai Restaurant the other night. 

I popped in after the gym and errands to get my order to go. I ordered a Thai Iced Tea for here and ordered the Panang Curry with Vegetables and Prawns, Brown Rice and the pork egg roll appetizer to go.

The curry was incredible, the prawns were about medium sized and there were a decent amount for 1-2 people. The Pork Egg Rolls were okay, I guess I prefer vegetarian ones over pork but they were still pretty good.

Unfortunately I did not take any pictures of my meal as I was starving when I got home with all of this. I'm glad I tried this place out and satisfied my craving for curry. :)
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Quick, think of a popular Thai dish from which you can judge any Thai restaurant on...   

Does it involve thin rice noodles, bean sprouts, some protein, and crushed peanuts? If so, we're on the same page and we're talking Pad Thai. Now, what else is in Pad Thai? Oh yeah, deliciousness. Precisely what was missing from Regent's take on it. It's as if I said hold the deliciousness, or the kitchen simply ran out of it.

If I was by myself, ordered the Pad Thai, at half of it, and left disappointed, than this place would have received a single star for surprisingly still be in business. Fortunately for them, and my stomach, a friend of mine joined me and ordered the Chicken Pad See Ew. Deliciousness was in the recipe, maybe just a half serving, but it wasn't fully forgotten.

Overall Regent Thai was not even close to as good as the worst Thai food I've ever had before it. Not only did they fail on (what I think of) as a baseline dish, but there is nothing specifically appealing about the atmosphere, and unlike most Thai places in NY, it's not BYOB.
author: Armand K.

description:
I used to like this restaurant before I had children. their food is very good and I would of 
given them a 4 or 5 stars, but as a mom of 2, just not very welcoming with children . I hope they change their attitude towards having children.
author: Liz C.

description: Deliciousness and value come together. We went for lunch. Surroundings have  air of serenity, which is always nice. Tom yum soup wasn't the best I've had, but it was still tasty. Beef with chili, garlic, red bell pepper and basil was delicious but could've been hotter. I ordered it medium hot but would consider ordering this dish Thai hot. Lunch includes a generous serving of rice...$5.95! The guy likes the yellow shrimp and orders it every time he goes to Regent.
author: Bleep S.

description: good service and friendly atmosphere. The heat and spices on the dishes were just right for me. I don't like over-seasoned foods. So finding a solid Thai place like this one was delightful.
author: Charles L.

description: My new favorite Thai place! The Golden Bags are amazing, the staff is super nice, and the atmosphere is LOVELY. Super beautiful decor.
author: Rose K.

description: The food is good and service is great. Very enjoyable and then you get the check and it becomes amazing! You definitely get more than you pay for and to me you can't beat that.
author: Christopher Z.

description:
So my 2nd time back, was much of an improvement from my initial lunch experience here.  I came here for a post-work dinner here last evening, and was spoiled with window-nook seating in a nearly empty restaurant, with a very attentive waitress. My (Som Yum) fresh shredded green papaya salad came out very quickly and was delectably refreshing, especially with my Thai Iced Coffee.

The (Pla Muk Gra Prow) Sauteed squid dish was of a medium spice, which was perfect for a cold day.  Warmed up by the fresh aromatics of the chili, garlic, bell peppers and sweet basil.. all with a side of brown rice.

I don't crave Thai food too often, but this really did hit the spot, and now I have a hefty amount of left-overs for lunch in a few hours.  Delicious.
author: Ty T.

description: Great service. Wonderful lunch menu, and a nice quiet environment to actually enjoy your meal.
author: Gloria Z.

description: Regent Thai is the "old reliable" of SF Thai restaurants. I've been going there for 20 years, and it's the default option whenever I want something that I know will at least be decent. Portions aren't large, but at they're usually incredibly flavorful, aromatic and non-greasy. Staff is helpful and kind and they're always good for pick-up.
author: Jay H.

description:
My husband and I love the food here. It reminds us of food we've actually had in Thailand. I've brought a friend here as well and she enjoyed the food and service. 

Appetizers:
Stuffed Chicken Wings -- 2 large ones -- really tasty and our favorite so far, but if you want more to go around, I'd go with the Golden Bags.
Golden Bags -- crispy and delicious
Miang Kham -- not amazing, but a good choice for vegetarians and very peanut-e

Favorite Dish:
Mas Sa Man Nuer -- such tender beef (watch out for the Thai seasoning as there are small bulbous herbs, not sure what the exact name is, that give excellent flavor to the curry, but are extreme -- like pure ginger -- to eat)

Pad Thai -- yum, yum, yum!

I also had tasty chicken curry that was great, but I do find that their beef is more tender than their chicken.

Their Tom Yum Gung is perfectly seasoned as I often find a lot of Thai places make it too sweet or too sour. This soup was quite balanced. Not a lot else goes into it, so it's a great light dish.

NOTE: when it's crowded and there's a lot of chatting it can be a little harder to hear the person sitting across from you, but who needs to talk when they're stuffing their face with good food anyway? 

Seating area is usually fairly full -- so I'd recommend groups of 2-4, not more.
author: Michelle D.

description:
I love Thai food, and this place knows what they're doing. The Green Curry is delish! As is everything I've had here. 
Great little neighborhood spot with friendly services and reasonable prices.
author: Jihad L.

description: I have been going to this place for years.  The food is solid, the price is right, the decor is very pleasant, the service is attentive and the owner is a gem!  This is simply a great neighborhood restaurant and very consistent.  Granted, there are more "cutting edge" Thai places in the city, but you will have to pay.
author: Doug B.

description: Place rocked. Just a neighborhood Thai place, with high standards. Comfortable, clean, unrushed, balanced and bold flavors, tender meats, extensive menu. YES!
author: Andrew K.

description: Very well made thai food.. I live three block from the restaurant . Perfect for week nights.
author: Henry G.

description:
Best Thai food ever. I love it here--the green curry chicken is my absolute favorite but they do all the classics well. They have a superb budget-minded lunch menu (although you can still order a la carte if you want). 

Service is so friendly and evening take out is usually ready in 20 minutes or less.
author: Jackie C.

description: I've been going to Regent Thai since they opened about 10 years ago (or so). Delicious, consistent quality Thai food. Always fresh, always tasty and always a good price. I usually get vegetarian pad Thai, basil chicken and brown rice. Sometimes the fried egg rolls. This will be my go-to Thai spot forever.
author: Mama M.

description:
Delicious in every way.

Couldn't be happier to explore this charming side of SF. True gem.

Everything was hot, delicious and plentiful. Great service and really intimate relaxing interior. 

Highly recommend:
Yellow Curry
Pad See Ew
Fresh Spring Rolls w/ Crab

They Great wine selection too!
author: Lily M.

description: I give this place three stars because the BBQ Thai chicken look kind of ok and it does taste that good.
author: Isaac H.

description:
yum. Everything I've had has been delicious but standouts for me are Golden Salmon, Curry Salmon, Yellow Chicken Curry, anything with eggplant, 2x cooked duck and many others. I can't eat spicy food and they always accommodate and it's still delicious. Service is pleasant and dining room is elegant yet still friendly. I limit myself to 2x month take out and end up jonesing for that salmon. 

Take out counter is always busy and they're on the phone constantly. Apparently they have online ordering but I'm not computer friendly, plus, it's a short and pleasant walk in the neighborhood. I prefer Regent to Alice's Thai restaurant around the corner which for me seems more like Chinese food.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Regent Thai is great! Definitely a neighborhood gem.

I've been here a number of times and have found superior service, pretty good food, and unbeatable prices. Today I ordered the lunch special ($5.25 for an order of Pad Se Ew!). That's almost unheard of in this day and age! They told me over the phone that the portions were going to be smaller, but it was still a decent size. Pork tasted super fresh and the veggies were cooked to perfection.

Definitely not the absolute best Pad Se Ew I've had but worth the price and convenience if you're in the neighborhood.

I've also tried their pad thai, and pumpkin curry here which are both great!
author: Eliza F.

description:
This is some above-average standard/generic Thai food. Pad Thai blah blah blah blah Fried Spring Rolls blah blah blah Yellow Curry blah blah. No, in all seriousness, the double-cooked roast duck is excellent, it comes served on a bed of steamed spinach. Also, the waitresses are all friendly as can be and wear those cool traditional Thai dresses (the "Ruean Ton" if Wikipedia is accurate, which it always is).

One time I ordered take-out and when I picked it up I got a Thai iced tea to go. Like an idiot, I spilled the entire cup all over the counter and floor before I could even take a sip. They couldn't have been nicer about that incident, smiles all around as they gave me a free refill on the iced tea and sent me on my way (even though I could practically hear them thinking "Now take it and get the fuck outta here you clumsy cracker"). Good lookin' out.
author: Trav W.

description:
We lived 1 block away from Regent Thai, and it quickly became a "go to" place for our family.

Wonderfully friendly staff, solid food, and good prices.  Our favorite items were the Tofu Choo Ros and the Tom Kha Gai soup.

Good location on the J train 29th st stop if you live in upper Noe Valley.  Good for families with young children (after all it is in Noe Valley...).
author: Steve J.

description: I've been coming here for years and years, even before I was married and had kids. With that said I have to say that this place is hit or miss. I've been here for lunch and dinner so many times and with so many combinations of food. This thai spot can either wow you or disappoint you. Maybe it's the chefs or he maybe it's the general manager, but please just provide a consistent product and your rating will reflect that.
author: George S.

description:
When my boyfriend and I used to live in the Crocker (I know, where IS that?) we were so deprived of good restaurants that we'd drive 20 minutes up to Noe Valley and get take out or eat there. 
Golden Bags, Miang Kham***, Pineapple duck curry***, Pad thai, any of the curries honestly I think they do the best curry I've had in SF? That may change though...oh and get their brown rice; it's beautiful.
author: Rose M.

description: Very good food..  I really enjoyed it.   The brown rice was good .  I had the pra ram pak .. the peanut sauce was smooth with peanut pieces and not watery .. I am pleased
author: Daniel C.

description:
This is the best Thai food I have found in San Francisco. I am Thai myself and come from a very judgmental family of Thai food and nothing has ever been good enough in this city when they come to visit, particularly my dad who has only ever liked one other pad thai dish (which is in Texas!).
I highly recommend the following dishes:
1) Pad Thai - amazing! The perfect amount of flavors and sweetness.
2) Golden Bags - What are these creations? They taste like heaven.. wonderful crisp heaven.
3) Stuffed Chicken Wings - simply delicious, the flavors are so yummy.
4) Deep Fried Spring Rolls - great crispy rolls
5) Miang Kham - Requires specific taste buds, but if you already have had this dish and like it, this is the best place to get it at.
6) Fried Rice - Yum! It's good for fried rice, not as good as the Pad Thai, but yummy all the same.
7) Shrimp crackers - sounds kind of gross to someone who has never had it, but they are good crunchy light crackers. They serve it as an appetizer in the restaurant and you can also order some with takeaway, even though it is not on the menu.

This place is just great. I have eaten in the restaurant and more often order takeaway because of the amazing prices. The service is great and the waiters are nice and friendly. 
You just cannot beat this place -- good food + good prices + they are so FAST.
My boyfriend and I order from them almost every week!

And yes, their rice is super cute.
author: Lia V.

description:
Good food and really good for kids. They brought my niece out a mickey mouse plate and cup of water with a straw immediately and didn't fuss at all when she accidentally spilled her rice on the floor. 

Will definitely go again when I have my baby
author: Tara H.

description:
Average food, tired decor and the rudest waitstaff in all of Noe. Took a Thai friend of mine to lunch a while back when he was visiting. Water glasses were never refilled, food that was ordered never arrived-even when we reminded the staff. 

At the conclusion of the meal, we weren't able to hail the waitress for our check. My Thai friend walked to the back of the kitchen to obtain our bill. He overheard the waitress in Thai commenting on what a couple assholes we were to keep asking for things. Haven't been back since.

Can anyone give me the Thai translation for "Regent Thai can kiss my ass" ? I want to make sure they understand me.
author: Christopher H.

description: I am truly perplexed at all the high praise this restaurant gets from Yelpers.  Anyway, we ordered a hot and spicy red snapper dish, Thai spring rolls and rice .  I almost gagged while eating the spring rolls because they were so awful.  The fish was flavorless in a bright red color that did not help the taste.  The only thing that tasted normal was the rice which is hard to do wrong.  I'm not sure if my stomach ache was due to the food not agreeing with my stomach or because I was so repulsed by the quality of this food while eating it.
author: sara l.

description:
I live within 3 blocks of this place and I think I would come here over, and over, and over, and over again!

Great food at great prices, you really can't go wrong with whatever you order here. The portions are a little smaller than what I'm used to at a value-priced Thai restaurant, but friendly service and very fast cooking definitely make up for it. You usually do not need reservations, restaurant accommodates many tables quite nicely.
author: Shang S.

description:
Julia D. suggested that we go here the other night, and what a delightful experience it was!

The evening began with me scoring a parking spot right in front.  HOLLER!  Then when I walked in I ran into a table full of my students.  It was a little awkward, but I like my students so it was fine.  Then I sat at a table and waited for Julia D.

The entertainment provided by the women sitting at the table next to us was unparalleled.  They were dropping F-bombs everywhere and I was thoroughly enjoying eavesdropping on their conversation.

Julia D. and I both ordered Pad Thai, and the $6.99 price tag made it taste even more delicious than it already was!  I will definitely come here again, and perhaps I will investigate other menu items.  Or maybe not.  The Pad Thai was really good...
author: Nora S.

description: I am so lucky that this restaurant is close by.  The food is really delicious, and it is always a pleasure to eat there, from the crunchy chips they bring you while you wait for your entree , to the well prepared, authentic Thai dishes that grace  your table, this unpretentious neighborhood place is always crowded.  The wine list is good, and the prices fair enough so you can order dessert!
author: D'oh S.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this restaurant yet, because it is my absolute favorite restaurant in the city. I eat here 2-3 times EVERY WEEK and don't get tired of it. The curries are all amazing, green red masaman... It's all amazing. The stuffed chicken wings are so good I just shove them in my face. I don't breath when I eat this food I just shovel it down my gullet. The tom-yum soup also delicious. Get everything "Thai hot". Their service is impeccable and fast, and they are so friendly. I would eat there every night if I wasn't worried they would think I'm weird.
author: Mike K.

description:
Regent has always been a great pick for Thai in the Noe/Mission area. Entrees are well-priced and portioned, and the service is great! 

Four stars because better Thai food is out there, but definitely not in the Noe/Mission area!
author: Adam K.

description: Good quality whether you dine in or takeout. We come here at least once a month for our Thai food cravings. I love the chicken with green beans and my husband loves the green curry. Even the classic pad Thai is good. Friendly staff and very clean.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
This is another of our dependable go-to places for very good Thai food.  Their service is very efficient so if you're in a hurry this place is great.  Some of my favorite dishes here:

Golden Bags
Duck Curry
Pad Thai
Egg plant
Tom Kha Gai
tofu choo ros

Only complaints: All dishes are good although their barbecue chicken is not the best I've had.
author: barry a.

description: Right level of spice, very good TomYum soup. Will go there again for a quick dinner. It helps that price is great too.
author: Balu V.

description: Great take-out place...we moved-in to the area recently, and needed some decent food - Regent is EXCELLENT!  Although oddly-named, the golden tea bags are a great appetizer.  Highly recommend the Eggplant, all the chicken dishes are phenomenal, and the take-out service is great.  Look forward to eating here a lot more often!
author: Bradley O.

description: This place is my go-to for take out Thai!! Super cheap, extremely delicious, fast and friendly staff! I've never dined in here but the place looks cozy and decorative. Every dish I've had has been full of fresh ingredients and they have high quality take out packaging so you know they care!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I love Regent Thai!
I've lived up the road from them for the past 11 years and have had takeout every week during that time, and each meal has been consistently excellent. Their cooking is so fresh tasting, light and awesome. Compared to the heavy glutinous sauces used by some of their chinese restaurant neighbors, Regent Thai is on a different level. The staff are always friendly, and it is usually crowded and bustling. On top of that prices are very reasonable. Recommendations? Try the spicy chicken wings, any coconut sauce curry, and the pad Thai and fried rice are fabulous.
author: Stuart L.

description:
Regent Thai is a favorite place for my family. They have excellent, tasty food and great service. The waitresses always bring the shrimp chips and dipping sauce to the table and we go through that quickly. Other favorites are the Golden bags (vegetarian),
love the Phla Gung salad although we order it mildly spicy and this dish has great flavor.

My personal favorite is the Sahai Ma Kur which is delicious. Again I like it mildly spicy but it's full of flavor and the eggplant is fantastic.

The Nuer Yang is flavorful and we eat this quite often. Favorite rice is the kao Pad. Very flavorful. I like it with the shrimp or pork most of all. there is something on the menu for all and plenty of vergetarian dishes as well.
author: Anthony L.

description:
I yelped before deciding to eat here, and expected a lot more. BOY WAS I WRONG!!! 

I understand that maybe people go here for the: Cheap lunch plates, uniforms, and wannabe upscale ambiance....

BUT!!!

BOO to the:

Worst fried banana with ice cream ever! They melt the ice cream in advance so they can stick raisins and cashews on them, and then they refreeze them. It took me FOREVER to finish because I was waiting for the ice cream to melt for so damn long. Plus the fried banana isnt crunchy, it's oily and soggy, and the banana tastes weird.

Stuffed chicken wing appetizer that serves ONLY 2 wings. 

5 of the shortest half-sticks of satay that I have ever seen.

The smallest portion of Pad Thai possible. 

The "ice water" that tastes like toilet and never has any ice.

Seating in the back that is worn and run-down.

Overcharging me on the hand-wrriten bill because they dont know how to do math. 

And lastly, THE RUDEST SERVICE EVER!!! These girls just want you to hurry up and eat your food. THEY BRING YOUR BILL AT THE SAME TIME THEY BRING YOUR FOOD... And dont even think about not leaving them a tip, you'll get dirty looks for days. 

Overall: 
The food is NOT spectacular or authentic-tasting. The service is horrible. The portions are NOT filling, and although it's cheap, the prices DO add up because you need to order more in order to feel full. Do NOT go there hungry or you'll go broke!!!
author: Joraine C.

description:
Overall, Regent has filled that special spot as a dinner place that we could eat almost any night. The price is awesome, food is fresh, and service is great. 

As frequent carry out customers, the staff on the phone is always nice and has never messed up an order -- if you get there before your order is ready, they are quick to offer water or tea and sometimes a little crunchy snack.

As for food, we have had a few dishes (the noodle dishes are average), but curry has become our standard. Red, Yellow, or Green, they are all fantastic (the pumpkin or squash they add makes it for me). 

As for price, Regent offers the best value for quality of any thai that we have tried in the city.

Now go and try the curry (any of them); odds are it is what we are eating tonight!
author: David M.

description:
I've been here 5 times and again it's a solid 4 stars.

I tried their chicken wings and Miang Kham and both were great. The Chicken Wings were bit sweet so if you have a sweet tooth, you'll like them. They were a bit on the small side though, so beware.

Also, we had entree #70, sorry folks, I can't remember the name, but it was basically fried fish dosed in thai sweet chili sauce, I thought this was the best dish we had that night.

I also had their Red Curry w/ Chicken. It was not too sweet but sweet enough that you just cant stop eating it.

A great place in Noe Valley, Simply put.
author: Eric A.

description:
Great!  
Green curry- amaz
Salads- super fresh
I have had other Thai in the neighborhood and this is the best.  New go to spot.
author: Meghan F.

description:
Hands down, the best Thai Food I've had. Especially considering that the prices are just right. Unlike the other restaurants around the city that have sky-high prices for subpar taste, Regent has some amazing dishes. From the salmon and their tender steak, to that delicious crunchy shrimp appetizer. 

I'm a San Francisco native that lived in the Bernal Heights/Noe Valley area for nearly 20 years, but I never visited Regent. (When you're a native, you tend not eat out as much - lol). My first experience was about 2 months ago - since then, i've been there 6 times. Now, when I want an inexpensive lunch, I scurry down to Regent.

I highly recommend it!
author: Edwin L.

description: The food had a chemical taste to it. It was definitely one of the worse Thai restaurants I've been to in SF.
author: Emma T.

description:
This is the absolute BEST lunch deal in all of SF! There should be lines out the door, but there's not b/c people are too lazy to trek to Noe Valley for lunch. Your loss.

I've never had any meal that wasn't 100% delicious here and the service is outstanding. They will know your name if you go often enough as I do.

The best Thai Lunch DEal in all of SF right here!
author: shanestar h.

description:
This is our go-to place for reasonably priced Thai food. We've been to two places in the Castro - Thai Chef and Thai House Express - and feel it's worth going the extra distance for Regent (on Rin's on 24th Street). Meals here typically run us between $20 and $30 (without drinks, depends on whether we just get two main courses or add an appetizer, soup, or salad).

We've probably been here 40 or 50 times over the years and we like a lot of the dishes. Probably my favorites are the golden (red curry) salmon, tofu choo ros, and gai regent. Anything in red chili paste is great, too. Soups and salads are reliable, as are a lot of the appetizers. (We love the golden bags, too - they seem to have been mentioned in a lot of the other reviews.) We like it that brown rice is an option. I can't remember ever having a dish here I thought was downright bad, although on rare occasions I've gotten things that were a little on the bland side. 

The service is ultra-friendly, and obsessed with keeping your water glass full. 

Lunches are not bad and very reasonably priced.
author: David G.

description: While the food is decent, service was horrible! I asked the waitress to recommend a curry and yet when my dish came out, it had no curry, when I asked if the could add curry it took the entire meal before it was received.
author: Sabina N.

description:
Great place if you are a white person who thinks salt is a spice. 

Thai people would hang their heads in shame. Fortunately this establishment is in in stroller valley SF.  Bland, boring, syrupy, has the atmosphere of a middle school cafeteria. Mormon food. If glen beck was a meal, he'd live here. As spicy and flavorful as a bowl of corn flakes.  
The pad thai, which NOBODY should screw up, was just bland and limp.  the golden bags were alright, but not memorable.  The soup was uninspired and dull, even to look at. 

I mean, ...really?  There are better spots.
author: Mark D.

description: You need to know what to get here, but after some trial and error I've got it down!  The soups are great...The Pad See Ew, this chicken and basil dish...and corkage is only $6, so definitely bring your own wine, they don't have much of a wine list!
author: john s.

description: This is a regular spot for us. Consistently good Thai food for takeout. Also a good place to get seated quickly for a last minute dine in...even with a party of six:) Which in our case means it is very kid friendly!
author: Jason W.

description:
came here again today - the appetizer Miang Kham is still to die for...the chicken basil with rice was just ok. I'll get the noodle dish (flat noodle with basil, chili) again.

lunch here is SO affordable - I'd say the same size portions, but half the price! $5.25 rice/noodle plate. Great deal!
author: Carol L.

description: Chicken Pad Thai and the Cashew Nut Chicken (Thai Hot) is the absolute best! Can't go wrong with either of the two plates. Top that off with a Thai Tea and you're set for a delicious and very filling dinner!
author: Aaron M.

description:
I live down the street from Regent Thai and I usually eat outside of Noe Valley, but this spot is one of my favorites during times when I am too lazy or unable to cook.
They have a variety of vegan options on the menu and tonight I had the   pad woonsen gra prow (Sauteed silver noodles, marinated tofu, mushrooms, vegetables with spicy chili garlic sauce and sweet basil) with a side of brown rice and it was delicious! I like their pad thai and coconut curry a lot as well but what I almost always order is the delicious golden bags except for tonight because I was on a tight budget.

The girls that work here are always very sweet and attentive and it is always very pleasant to eat here.

*WARNING to vegans and vegetarians: the complementary chips they serve are actually shrimp chips! I just kindly tell the waitstaff to take it back so someone else can enjoy them.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Everything is good but not great.  We pick it up b/c is very close to home.  

3 things to help you decide:

1) The Golden Salmon is tasty.
2) The Pad Thai is good but VERY SMALL.
3) I wish they gave larger portions for the cost.

UPDATED ALERT:
This place is now awesome - the key is to eat in!!!!

So damn good.

Pad Thai and BBQ beef were great - eat in only :)
author: A S.

description: This is my go to Thai place.  Great service, awesome value, and solid food.  Golden bags are my favorite appetizer, and their pad se-eiw is great.  Highly recommend when you're in the area.
author: Roy W.

description:
Yummy as always! Love the Gaeng Garee Gai (yellow curry) and Chicken Pad Thai. 

Also great for quick take-out.

Please be aware that this restaurant tends to be VERY cold so dress appropriately. Also, perhaps due to being in Noe Valley, popular with parents of small children and the volume can get loud...someone is always going to start crying...usually the kids, not the parents.
author: Katy C.

description:
Regent Thai turned out to be a pleasant surprise!  We hopped on the J-Church for a wild ride down Church St.   I didn't realize they raised the speed limit for MUNI metro cars to 55 mph!   We had planned on going to Eric's, but decided to go an extra stop to check out the restaurants around 29th Street.

What would it be?  Henry's Hunan, Clay Oven, Regent Thai?   We flipped a coin and chose Regent Thai.  It wasn't very busy, but it was around 9:00 PM in sleepy Noe Valley.

We started with the Thai Fresh Egg Rolls.  We expected the traditional cool & crisp fresh springs rolls, but these were really more like egg rolls., jut not fried.  They were good, not sure we'd them again though.  Be sure to try the citrus mustard that comes with them - I missed it until the very last bite.

Next up was Yellow Curry (Gaeng Garee Ga)  and Spicy Noodles (Pad Kee Mao).  The curry was really good with a refreshing, crisp, cool cucumber salad on the side.  The Spicy Noodles were sweet and spicy with a heat that caught up to you after a few bites.

We always order the same thing so this time I decided to try something new.  We ordered the Pra Ram Gai which is chicken with vegetables with a mild peanut curry.  The peanut curry is more like a thick paste, thicker than what you would normally get with fresh spring rolls.   It was delicious!

The prices are really affordable - entrees were in the 6-8 dollar range.  Service was polite.  By the time we left around 9:45 the place was full!
author: Ed J.

description:
My dad did some construction work at this restaurant so we come here quite often to eat. The appetizers here, are THE BEST. Everything on the menu is good, but once you hit the appetizers, there's no need to go on to the entrees because you'll be too stuffed!

Ordered:
- Satay Chicken AND Beef
- Golden Bags (MY FAVORITE)
- deep fried shrimp egg rolls
- spicy chicken wings
- penang curry
- massa man curry
- thai iced tea! ----this is legit, folks.

This list is just to name a few. I can't remember everything I've had, but what I have eaten there has always been DELICIOUS. 

They have great service and the restaurant really gives you an authentic look with its Thai decorations and uniforms the waitresses wear. 

Parking can just be a little difficult in the evening hours.
author: Julia K.

description:
Regent Thai is def my favorite Thai food in the City, and it is right down the block from me. I feel like people tend to flock to Erik's on Church Street instead of trying out all the other delicous Asian eats down the street (see also my review of Hunan Henry's).

Top favorite things about Regent Thai:
- The pad kee mao. So friggin good. Just the right amount of chewy and lots of fresh vegetables. 
- Their corkage fee...it's so cheap I don't feel bad about bringing in cheapo-depot bottles of vino!
- Their curries...both the green and the red. Again, the veggies make the dish.
- The bill comes, and it is cheap. Four of us went out to dinner a few weeks ago, and got a ton of dishes to share, and the total was $11 a person. When does that happen in this City!?

Extra tip: Regent Thai also has great lunch specials so don't be shy about a mid-day meal.
author: Christina C.

description: Great lunch special prices--pad thai was only $5.25!!! The service was great, super friendly, quick, and my water & tea cups were never empty. My new favorite spot for thai food in the city.
author: Natalia K.

description: Good, reasonably priced food in a nice atmosphere. Great service!
author: Lee R.

description:
Excellent Thai food, very friendly service and good atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone. My husband and I had dinner here with our 2 year old son. They cater well to kids. Although there was no special kids menu, the meals are all so inexpensive, you can just order your kid a normal meal (and then eat half of it yourself ;-)

Super friendly service with a smile. And a genuine one! Awesome place. We will for sure be back here.
author: Viola M.

description:
I have been a fan of this spot for many years after a friend of mine got me hip to the skip. The food is always fresh, well presented and flavorful. You never taste anything odd or mysterious as it is prepared with such care. All of my friends, family and general loved ones know that this is the place I go out to dinner. I am pretty familiar with the staff although I only eat there a few times a year. 
The people are warm, kind and very attentive. The level of friendliness has always been sincere. I always feel like I am visiting relatives because the experience is so easy. I highly recommend this spot. It is some of the best Thai food I have ever eaten and I grew up in San Francisco.
YUMMY!
author: JD C.

description:
This is my favorite Thai place in the city.  Their prices are reasonable and their food is excellent.  Thai restaurants are usually good for their curries, but my favorite is actually their Tofu Choo Ros, a crispy tofu sauteed in chili, garlic, cashews, and sesame seeds.  I like how they top this dish with these yummy seaweed-like strings, which they claim is a type of mustard (?).  Anyway, I could eat that stuff over and over again until I never get sick of it.

1 star off: no desserts
author: Ally W.

description: A friend took me to this place, but I am now a fan! This place had some of the best Pad Thai that I've ever eaten. The Thai tea is amazing as well. Parking can be problematic during peak times, but it is usually not more than a short walk even if you can't find close parking.
author: Bradley V.

description: Love the green curry chicken the Tom yum soups are great pad thai with shrimp and you simply must have fried banana with coconut ice cream ! Staff is very nice too
author: lyn m.

description:
If I were rating this place for their food alone then I would have given them a 4--they haven't got the best Thai food I've ever had but it's pretty darn good! What made me give them the full 5 stars in their service. I was shocked that a place where most of the entrees cost under $8 had the service of a high-class gourmet establishment.

I came here with my girlfriend and my aficionado, Thai-loving father. We both love spicy food but decided to settle on medium heat for the evening to include my girlfriend. They serve a very modest American Medium Spicy here, not a Thai Medium, which is good to know if you are sensitive to spicy food.

I loved the way that the food was paced out into courses. A lot of places try to get all of the food ready at the same time and then just dump it on the table when it's ready and leave you to it. Not so here. We were served tasty shrimp crackers with a sweet and spicy sauce before we had even looked at the menu and when our Tom Yum Kai soup arrived the waitress portioned out each bowl and placed one in the middle of each of our plates! The soup was good but I could have dealt with a little more spice even with our Medium spice setting.

Next came the Twice Roasted Duck which was to die for. It was definitely the favorite dish of each of us. We also had the Pad Thai and a Shrimp dish which the waitress recommended and both were delicious as well. Looking at the portions of each dish, you would never be able to guess that each cost less than $8!

The staff was polite and professional and everyone seemed happy to be there. The atmosphere was casual yet refined.

Would I go back? I certainly will. It was a delight.
author: Aaron W.

description:
So I have not had the best Thai food over the past couple of years while living overseas. That said, I was really looking forward to having some SF Thai food when I got home. Regent Thai was pretty good and the price was AWESOME. Lunch for two: $20.75. That included two soups, two entrees, one lemonade and water for the table. 

Tons of vegetarian options. I'm used to ethnic food restaurants having veggie options but not nearly this many. Even a section specifically for healthy veggie options that were low in fat. 

The service was average at best but the food was good and the price was right. I'd try them again if in the neighborhood.
author: Heather L.

description: Very tasty Thai vegetarian dishes! Staff are very cordial and always smiling. Highly recommend!
author: Patricia L.

description:
I went here for lunch with a friend on Sunday.  I ordered a spicy tofu and veggies dish.  What I liked:

--The veggies seemed really fresh
--The food was not oily
--The portion size was perfect
--Fast friendly service
--Good value, our meal came to less than $20 (two people)

I didn't have to use the restroom while I was here, but it seemed like a clean and well-organized place.  The ambiance was nice.  Also, I loved how they shaped my rice into a heart (My friend got a star)!!  So cute.  This would probably be a great date place.
author: Liz M.

description:
MMMMMMM Duck. I actually have a love-hate relationship with duck. I love how it can be so tender and tasty, but hate when it drips with obscene amounts of oil. Thus I am very cautious about where I order it and how it is prepared. 

Similarly, I am just as cautious and picky about Thai food. I have had some great Thai dishes, and others that have made me sick and nauseous. 

Enter in Regent Thai. Not only does this restaurant serve up some of the tastiest duck but their yellow curry comes with tender morsels of duck and delicious chunks of fresh pineapple in a lightly sweetened coco-nutty curry. Their chicken pad thai is equally as good with tender chicken and great bits of tofu in it. 

Service is phenomenal. We once were there 10 minutes before closing and they sat us and served us right away. And prices are some of the best I have seen for the quality that we get.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Regent hates when you bring out-of-towners.  They must, because they never seem to want to be open when I have family and friends from hundreds of miles away who finally come to try this Thai place that I have been raving about.  It's like that one cool thing that you did that one time when nobody was around and now you can't make it happen again for anybody to believe you.  Anyways, even if I can't prove it, I know the truth of Regent Thai's awesomeness.

Regent Thai is very charming.  It sits in the middle of a peaceful neighborhood, right along my favorite Muni Metro line (The J).  The waitresses are always fancified with curled hair and traditional-looking dresses.  When they serve rice from the exotic aluminum rice dishes they always ask "Rice please?", rather than "Would you like some rice?"  But who was ever offended by servers being over-courteous?  Not I, in fact, I think it's kinda cute.

You'll notice that most of their appetizers are fried goodies, except the Miang Kham.  The Miang Kham is a very interesting, but very tasty, dish.  I think it is toasted almonds, ginger, lime, cocnut, and dried shrimp on top of single spinach leaves and served with a sweet sauce.

If I took the time to discuss every dish here, this would turn out to be an even lengthier review, so I will just hit a few more points.

- If you ask for something "extra hot", you gon' get it!

- The ratio of fresh vegetables to other ingredients in the dishes makes for a happy digestive system.

- Strange Thai chips "chicharones" are served when you arrive.

- Prices are LOW and food is served FAST!

- Overall, my favorite Thai food experience so far (and I've even eaten Thai food in Thailand)
author: Jesse M.

description: Super good, super affordable, super quick. That describes this place. Amazing pad Thai, great portions and amazing prices! I'd highly recommend it for a quick, good, wholesome thai meal!! I've always gotten take out so I can't speak for the service.
author: Aabhas S.

description: I love this place. Used to go to the old location on Monterey all the time until it closed. I always order the catfish fillet with eggplant (forget what number it is). I can't seem to find that dish at any other Thai restaurant. I also recommend getting the Golden Bags as an appetizer.
author: K G.

description: I love Regent Thai's Gai Regent (#41). Service is always polite and efficient.
author: Matt T.

description: Well My wife felt like some thai for dinner. so she stopped by regent for some take away. It was awful. pad thai dry with no extra sauce. No sauce at all really.Tthe spring rolls were wrapped in some kind of weird pasta instead of rice paper.Tthey put in, And I'm not kidding a half a teaspoon of yellow mustard as a condiment instead of chinese hot mustard. what a jip. NEVER eat there again. If anyone thinks this is good, they have never eaten good thai food. Seems like the place is eaedy to out of biz when they start cutting these corners.
author: Daniel M.

description: The food here is so tasty that we've gotten in the habit of having lunch here almost every weekend. Our favorite first courses are the golden bags (rice paper stuffed with potatoes and veggies then fried till crispy) and the tom kha galay soup. For main dishes, we love the chicken with green beans, as well as the pad see eiw and the guay tiew gai kua. So far, we haven't had anything we didn't like. The dining room is a pleasant space, and the service is always prompt, friendly, and courteous. Recommended!
author: David K.

description: I have eaten here before and have always liked it a lot. I haven't been here in a long time, but I ate here recently and my entire meal was cold, including the brown rice.
author: Nora S.

description:
"YA GOTTA LOVE A YUMMY THAI THAT'S CLOSE BY!"

After a bad ass, butt kicking work out.... your body screams food! Of course sometimes your mouth has veto power and wants a certain kind of food. The Pad-Kee-Mow here is sublime. As are their Golden dumplings. Their mixed vegetable salad is very good for you vegans  (hmmph, vegans...)

The parking can be a pain, so getting the food To-Go may be a better option.
ENJOY !
author: Mark B.

description:
We have been eating there several times (nica and cosy) but mostly ordering take out. Food is great with very reasonable pricing. 
I like the stuffed chicken wings, green curry and also the red curry. The spring rolls are very nice and I also had the liced beef sauteed with fresh chile.
The waitresses are very friendly and take care of you very well.
author: Dan Z.

description:
Yippee I have just found my new favorite Thai place in SF.  Even though the food is just as good as some of my other favorite places in the city...what sets this place a part is the unbelievably reasonable prices!  

For dinner the average dish is $6.252 which is almost $3-4 less then other Thai places.  Also, Regent Thai has the appetizer bags of gold that are vegetarian, which I could not find anywhere else.  

Things I tried which I recommend:
Golden Bags - yummy crispy curryness
Vegetable Yellow curry - perfect balance of flavor and spice
My mom had the chicken lemongrass soup and she loved it as well as the eggplant tofu dish.
The fresh spring rolls were a little different than I am used to but they were still tasty.
Lastly, service is good and attentive, plus they all wear traditional clothing which adds to the experience. :-)
author: Molly M.

description: One of the best thai places around San Francisco. The food is never too oily and the distinguishing factor that makes this place so amazing is how authentic the dishes taste. I frequent this place (despite the fact that there are so many other amazing restaurants in SF) because it truly is a gem.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Normally when you see two chili peppers next to a dish on the menu, you expect it to be spicy, and not drenched in sweet and sour sauce with a few nubs of garlic in it. The food was not even remotely spicy, and my wife's choice of prawns/scallops in a red curry sauce yielded a mostly bamboo shoots. 

Didn't have a problem with the service, but the food was not really that great.
author: Owen R.

description:
We live right up the street, so Regent is a go-to for us.  

The service here is fabulous.  Almost TOO fabulous.  You take a sip of water and they are immediately refilling it and saying "thank you".  

The food is also good.  The beef with broccoli is wonderful and the pad thai is so-so.  We also love the green curry.
author: Sara C.

description: If I lived closer, I would be here all the time. The Tom Kha was DELICIOUS (which is awesome, since a lot of places put too much MSG in theirs and it makes it really salty), as was the black bean pork and eggplant dish I ordered. The best part of this place is the lunch special menu, which is SUPER extensive and phenomenally cheap. (Seriously, my entire lunch - meat dish, side of rice, soup, and a Thai iced tea - was $10 with tip.)
author: Tori G.

description:
I ordered takeout.

Pros: Order was ready quickly, packed well (all of the extras I requested were included), and service was friendly. The prices were reasonable.

Cons: Sadly, the taste was completely lacking. The penang curry was tasteless and watery, heavy on the large chunky vegetables and skimpy on the shrimp (understandable at a $9 price point). The spice was  nonexistent - "thai hot" tasted like mild to me. The pad see ew was strong on fish sauce and did not have much sweet soy sauce flavor. #58, a seafood curry, was about as forgettable and bland as the penang, but with different vegetables.  

My three dishes were $27, including tax, but sadly, they were not tasty. I won't return. However, I will say, the business seemed busy on a Saturday night, so if you live in the area and like your food on the blander side, give them a try since other Yelpers like them.
author: B B.

description: not bad but not the greatest thai food but i keep going back. the reason why i'm giving this place a 3 star is due to the inconsistency of the seasoning. some days it's too salty or it's under seasoned. besides that i definitely recommend this place.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: The food was very tasty and reasonably priced. We did takeout and had their fried rice (and they were nice enough to let us substitute brown rice), the papaya salad, the silver noodle salad (kinda the weak link here) and another noodle dish. The ingredients tasted fresh and they don't skimp on the protein. Definitely will go back.
author: Alice W.

description: Fantastic!  Simply put this place has incredibly tender meat, flavorful sauces and excellent service.  I am seriously addicted to thai food, you can ask my bf, it's actually a joke at this point, and regent is my favorite place in the whole city!
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Ok, my landlord told me about this place.  She said it was the best Thai in the city...so I thought I would go try it out....and I'm glad we did.  The dishes where flavorful.  I had Moo Yang, it was good but I really liked the Tom Kha Gai, it was wonderful, hence the 4 star review....it was the best I have tasted here in the city... even better than Thai House Express (which is a personal favorite).  I would come back here as it's on the south end of Church street so I don't think there would be a long wait.

I look forward to trying all these great places in here in NOE valley.
author: Blake J.

description: I love this place.  The gals in the kitchen use fresh ingredients.  The service is always friendly and helpful. The food is great.  Been eating here and getting take out for 15+year.  support a local business owner who is there almost every night!
author: Jennifer P.

description: This is one of my neighborhood favorites.  I am biased to the golden bags and Tofu yellow curry.  You can get brown rice or white rice with your meal.  The lunch specials as very inexpensive...where can you get a main dish for $5.25?  Service is always good and friendly.
author: Lily B.

description: Great neighborhood feel. Excellent/quick service. Pra Ram Nuer is a must have.
author: Aaron H.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco.  

1. Best green curry ever 
2. Lots of fresh vegetables
3. Affordable
4. Great lunch specials
5. Friendly and attentive service

Dishes that I love:

Golden Bags - wrapped fried curried potatoes
Gaeng Khiew Warn Gai - Green Curry w/ chicken
Pad Woonsen Gra Prow - Silver noodles w/tofu and veggies
Gai Pad Woonsen Pak Ruam -  Chicken w/veggies and silver noodles
Tofu Choo ros - Deep fried tofu with cashew nuts.

The negative: parking can be rough. 
(If public transportation is an option, the J Church line runs right in front of the restaurant.)
author: Susan Y.

description:
I drive from Petaluma for Regent.  I'd waste time writing down recommendations, but it's simply be reiterating almost the entire menu.  The appetizers are the best I've ever had at a Thai restaurant, and although the curries aren't the absolute best, everything else makes up for it again and again.  The ability to adjust spiciness in each dish makes everybody at the table a happy camper.

Parking can be rough in the evenings, and near impossible on weekends, so give yourself 10-20 minutes to drive around or walk from your distant parking place.
author: Roland F.

description: Bottom line, love this place. Quality food at rock bottom prices. Super friendly service, we have been coming back for years and years. Tofu roos is fantastic as well as the cashew chicken. But everything is good.
author: Claire H.

description:
I hate it when a bad experience ruins a nice meal.  This was a huge WTF!  Let me start by saying that both our dishes were prepared well.  Lots of options on the menu and we ended up ordering the Pad see ew and the yellow curry shrimp and scallops that wasn't bad for $8.  The yellow curry was more like a red curry and the scallops were a kinda over done. The portion sizes were also kinda small relative to what I'm used to at Thai Noodle, but the Pad see ew was done well and the veggies were fresh and crisp.

My issue however was with the service.  My wife & I were having a good time so the slow service didn't bother us too much, but never have I been challenged to stand my ground so resolutely by a server.  Maybe she's taking a negotiating class and trying to practice her new skills.  After ordering a house wine for $3.50 I was charged $6.  Upon mentioning the mistake I was told that I didn't order the house wine and my server proceeded to argue without rational.  It was really uncomfortable.  In the end I got charged for what I ordered but couldn't believe the night ended with such a public confrontation over $2.50
author: Ken F.

description: my family loves this place. food is better in the restaurant than take out, but always good no matter what. the best satay around- the chicken melts in your mouth. love everything i've ever had there- the noodles, the curries, the appetizers... the waitresses are friendly and attentive. we're regulars cause it's so reliable, fresh and flavorful
author: Peggy W.

description:
sub $6/person for generous tasty lunch portions = awesome value!

In the 9 months I've lived in Noe Valley, I've frequented Regent no less than 20 times.

I highly recommend the Pad Ki Mao, extra spicy.
author: Nick H.

description:
One of my favorite places EVER. The prices are great, the staff is exceptional, and their food always hits the spot.

My boyfriend and I always get the green curry with chicken and order something different for our second dish. Love the chicken satay, pad thai, ALL of their soups....I'm salivating as I'm writing this.

Definitely check this place out. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Miss Tina Sparkle S.

description:
My new favorite Thai restaurant (anywhere). I watched every seat fill up between 6 and 7pm on a Friday night.  So, I know I'm not their only fan.  This place offers a beautiful setting, flavor-packed dishes, healthy and colorful fresh vegetables, great prices, and friendly service.

I highly recommend the basil eggplant ("Tofu Pad Ma Kuer"). The eggplant was perfectly prepared with sweet basil and black bean sauce that you can drizzle over rice for extra flavor.  The Tom Kha Gai soup, made with coconut milk and lemon grass, was also excellent.  If you order the vegetarian version, you'll receive a generous assortment of fresh vegetables (carrots, snap peas, broccoli, mushrooms, cilantro, etc.).  Even the Pad Thai had something special - limey nutty mix of flavors. Plus, hot Thai Tea is availabe for $1.

Can't wait to go back. I have studied the take out menu and circled items to try in the future: Golden Bags with tamarind sauce, Ginger Salmon, and a variety of veggie dishes.

Parking Tip-

Look for parking further north on Church St. I can generally find a spot around 26th and Church or on one of the side streets.
author: Heather W.

description:
This is my absolute favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  Eating in or taking out, I have never had a bad meal here.  And it's SO CHEAP. 

Some of my favorite dishes:

Chicken satay - the peanut sauce is AMAZING

Gung Gra Brog - deep fried shrimp in egg roll skins, always served piping hot

Mas Sa Man Nuer curry - my dinner partner ordered this and I think I ate more of it than he did

Nuer Kee Mao - I just wish it had more beef because the spices make it so good

And it goes on and on.

The service is amazing.  They are always extremely friendly, the food comes out quickly, and they now know me since I pick up all the time.
author: Molly K.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and Regent Thai's my go to place for food. Good prices, delicious and great service. What's not to love? 

Visiting friends / family always enjoy the flavor, and it's a really nice, relaxed atmosphere.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Water review only:

Glass Size: Small and wimpy
Longest time with empty glass: 1 minute 37 seconds

+ points for lemon wedge in glass.  The servers tagged team water duty. The servers were to my water glass like white on rice on a paper plate in a snowstorm.
author: Mark S.

description: I live really close by the Regent Thai and I have had hundreds of meals there over the years.  They are fantastic - delicious food and great, friendly service all for reasonable prices.  You won't be disappointed.    Their Tom Kar Gai is one of the best I've tasted.
author: Tom W.

description:
Ok seriously...I haven't had better Thai food than this.
Words can't explain how ecstatic I was before, during and after eating here.
The service was the BEST!!!!!
My friend is a frequent eater here and took me here 9:30pm Saturday night. OMG....where has this place been all my life.
The food came out soooo fast!!!!
Great family business!  I have been craving it ever since I left :)
A MUST TRY AND WELL WORTH 5 STARS :)
Thanks Regent Thai...you are officially my favorite :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
Family dinner with my bf's family and really enjoyed the graceful service but the food was average and not spectacular enough for a repeat....especially since it isn't in my neck of the woods. 

*Yum Pla Muek - Seafood, calamari salad
*Pad Kee Mao - spicy stir-fried thick rice noodle
*Duck Salad
*Gang Sohm - spicy soup
*Som Tum - papaya salad
author: Katie K.

description:
Ahh, my local Thai place--what a treasure.  We all have one, right?  The place you go for good eats for two, gets you in and outta there quickly and cheap, too.  gotta love it.

A friend of mine who grew up in Noe turned me on to this place.  I believe his exact phrase was "yellow curry chicken is bomb."  I couldn't have said it better m'self.  Shrimp pad thai is always a good standby.  I'd also check out the coconut curry soup, and the pork chops.  Heck, I've tried quite a few things on the menu...all good. 

Service is quick and very good.  I actually took a large group of people here.  They sectioned off half the restaurant for my 30-top and staggered the courses to room full of smiling faces.
author: Chad K.

description:
In my opinion, a five star restaurant is one like Regent Thai. 5 stars are not limited to fine dining experiences in which one must dress up and be served appetizer portions on huge plates. 

5 stars consists of friendly staff who remember their customers and care about them. It's fresh, amazing tasting food. Cleanliness and convenience. All of which are qualities of Regent Thai.

I've only been here a few times but it's left such a good impression on me and my tummy that I will continue to come back and I'm sure soon the waitresses will know me by name as well. 

Bonuses= inexpensive and brown rice option. Mmm...
author: Angelina F.

description: i'll keep my review short and simple. food was great, very fresh and authentic thai flavor. my boyfriend and i got the hot and sour prawn soup, chicken pad thai and a beef dish that came with blanched veggies and a peanut sauce (can't remember the name). the pad thai uses skinny rice noodles compared to the usual fat ones but it still tasted really good. if you have a preference for the fat ones you may want to ask for those to be substituted instead. my boyfriend also got a beer and everything came out to $33 before tip. our waitress was friendly and our water glasses were never empty so our meal came out to $40 because we felt like she deserved it. definitely recommended!
author: Alyssa L.

description: The things I love the most about Regent Thai: friendly, warm service; fresh and abundant vegetables; flavors that pop; and lots of extra little touches that make me smile. It's my neighborhood favorite.
author: Barb V.

description:
Thai food Virgin:

This is the first place where I first tried Thai Food. It has set the standard and I compare the taste to other places. The food is excellent and the  location is second to none. I love the fact that when I eat here - I feel tranquility. I like the atmosphere at this restaurant and like that the people there are nice and they will do whatever to please you. For starters, I recommend that anyone who has not eaten thai food to come here. Order a Thai Iced Tea and the Chicken or Tofu pad thai. I also recommend the chicken Pad See Ew (Thick noodle). It's a great place to go for lunch since it's cheaper. Great portions and good clean food. The water is free and you can get as many refills as you want :).
author: John A.

description:
Yum.  Yum yum yum yum yum.

Granted, I've never met a plate of Thai food that I didn't agree with but this place is delicious and the service is awesome.  I'm a huge Pad See Ew fan and this is one of my favorite places to order it.  The curry is really great too.

Pad See Ew+rice+to go+crappy movie+pink wine=my vision of Heaven.  Try it.
author: Suzanne K.

description:
I've actually never sat down and eaten here. I always get take out.

I can't get enough of the stuffed chicken. I think #45 beef dish is really good too.
author: L R.

description:
Since my previous favorite Thai restaurant changed owners, Regent Thai has made my top list of Thai restaurants.  My boyfriend doesn't like Thai food much but I forced him to try this restaurant and reluctantly, he did....*Mission Accomplished*  

We ordered the Golden bags, Golden Salmon, Thai Fried Rice and BBQ beef!!! All exceptionally good and my boyfriend had no complaints.  He even said..."You need to Yelp this place" haha!  Scooore!  This will definitely be a Thai restaurant I will frequent to!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
One of my favorites for many years.

Great food.  Not quite Lotus of Siam (way off the Strip in Vegas - believe it or not) but solid - and worth it.  Attentive service.  Consistent.

One caveat:  go after 7p to avoid the screaming kids.  Not a pan on the restaurant but on the idiots who refuse to stifle their shrieking darlings until the other patrons stand up and threaten bodily harm.
author: Steve F.

description:
I am never coming here again. Their service is terrible and the waitstaff was rude. 

I ordered some food, took it home, realized that we were missing a dish, so I called back and the lady was rude, but said she would "have one for me in 10 minutes". So now I have to drive back over there. I get there and the waitress who took my order in teh first place walks straight up to me and says "You never ordered that. I didnt put it on there because you didnt order it." No apology, not even an acknowledgement of a  misunderstanding. 

So the manager or whatever takes care of me and says the same thing to me. When I answer that I was standing right there when we ordered our take out food and we ordered it she is almost yelling at me that its my fault. So she gives me the bag of food and Im about to walk out and she says $10.38. I ask her if I really have to pay for this since I had to come back and Ive been yelled at since I walked in teh door. The manager is literally yellign at me now, "You didnt order, Im not giving it to you". I tell her Im never coming here again. 

I get back and tell Tara that I was getting yelled at so I didnt get the food and she calls and has a yelling match with the manager for 40 minutes. The manager is spending 40 minutes of her time when the place is busy to yell at us. 

F- that. I was so sick of that place that I threw the rest of the food out. Im never going here again.
author: Adam L.

description: My husband and I have been going here frequently (and I mean like a few times a month frequently) for years. We love the wait staff, we love the food, and we love the prices.  The red and green curry, pad thai, pad kee mao, golden bags, and  salad kaek are just a few of our favorites.  If they delivered we would be in big trouble...
author: Sarah R.

description:
I've been to this restaurant twice: once on a first date with a new guy, and once on the last date with the same fella.  Didn't even realize it until all the pieces were in progress.

The first date was great, got some exercise and rode bikes around the entire area looking for a place where Spandex-clad SweatyPersons were welcomed.  Food was great, service was unobtrusive.  A+

Four months later, we've *just* broken things off and decide to get some food together.  Where do we end up?  Bravo, Irony.  You got me again.  Somehow, even a "last meal" was very enjoyable.  Someone was doing something right.
author: Mari C.

description:
Thai noodle salad with pork and shrimp..... it was great.  Vermicelli glass noodles with lots of lettuce and a really good vinegar based sauce.  The Tom yum gai was great, because we asked for extra veggies.  The sauce wasn't as interesting, zesty, or "deep" as I have had... but the broccoli, beans, and other extra veggies on top of the normal ones was a treat.

Yelp is so arbitrary.  It isn't that good of thai... it is GREAT discount AWESOME THAI...

but not the best.  So whereas it would be a 5 for cheap thai, it would be a 3 for high end thai.  ??  How do you reconcile that?  Maybe create a multi tiered review process like TripAdvisor?

But great staff, menu, choices, wine list is decent... and cheap!

Kitchen is bright and visible from the floor with a viewing window.  Great place.  Our whole dinner bill for two meals shared and drinks was $25 (including tip)
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Duck curry and spicy spinach chicken were real good.  Bring your duct tape for the noisy little kids though.
author: Rock Rock Robot Rio G.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. The tables are set nicely and the servers are dressed in beautiful Thai attire. The atmosphere is comfortable and service is very friendly. The food is excellent. And it helps a whole bunch that the food is super affordable!

Will visit again!
author: Camille T.

description: Charming little spot in the Noe Valley/lower Diamond Heights area. From what I understand, this is an all female run business as well - and if that's the case, these ladies know their stuff. All the portions were great - not too big or small. All the food was fresh and delicious. (and yes, the golden bags are really a must have). and they had some of the yummiest Thai Iced Tea/Iced Coffee I have ever consumed. The servers were extremely attentive and sweet, and everything we had was spot on. I'll definitely be going back to Regent Thai - a true gem of the city.
author: Marco M.

description:
When I first moved to noe valley a year ago, i ate at this place atleast once a month and thought the quality was quite good all though the food is a little more "americanized" than a lot of thai places i have been too.  this place lacks a lot of the spice and flavor a lot of thai food packs and i think that is part of the reason i though it was "good" but not great.  

In any event I ate there last night for the first time in months and it was just dreadful.  I live right up the street so I called in my order for pick-up and when i got there they were about to close.  I don't know if this is the reason for my food being absolutely dreadful or if it is they have started skimping due to the economy?   Anyway I ordered the "Vegetarian Lovers"  a favorite of mine and once I opened the box I was extremely disappointed.  Once lovingly fried large portions were 3 green beans, 3 small pieces of sweet potato, and 3 slim over-cooked triangles of tofu.  My roommate got the SALAD KHAEK and had to ask for extra tofu (which they charge a dollar for) when really the amount of tofu in the salad after you ask for EXTRA is about the amount you would expect without asking (and paying) for extra.  Basically this place nickle and dimes you for EVERYTHING while skimping on EVERYTHING in the first place, not the kind of thing you'd expect from a thai place with all ready high prices.  

Basically I say if you want to try this place SKIP IT!  you can find other places that give you more food for the money and whose employees don't convey an overly saccharin sweet disposition that makes you feel less violated for being nickle and dimed for everything in the first place.  Save your money and go else where....and may I just mention my roommate got a sweet case of food poisoning from the salad...yes I said SALAD, can we say cross-contamination?
author: Morgan B.

description: Consider the average Thai food-loving San Franciscan with steady income.  From how many different restaurants does he or she order Thai food take-out in a lifetime?
