After moving around the city for 13 years, I must be up to 25.  I've enjoyed the food from 50% of them, found 40% non-descript and have been disappointed by 9%.  But the 1%, that's Regent Thai, the only exceptional Thai take-out I've had in San Francisco.  The flavors are fresher, the vegetables more crispy, the meats of a higher quality, the saltiness more moderate and the oils used more sparingly.  After eating Thai Regent's takeout for the first time, I said, "That was great Thai take-out!"  When was the last time you said that?
author: Charlie P.

description:
3 words: 
  - $5 lunch specials!! ++++
  - Bug in water - - - - -

Final verdict when I've eaten at this place 100 times, which I plan on doing since the green chicken curry here was currylicious!
author: Pete C.

description:
Unfortunately my experience for lunch was similar to my dinner experience - thus my two stars remain unchanged.

Just tried this place for lunch today - reasonable prices but very disappointed with the portion size and food.  It's just 'ok' - nothing very memorable about this place. 

I left feeling hungry and disastisfied.  It's so ashame - great location, cute restaurant, friendly staff.
author: Gina C.

description:
Super fresh Thai food, very clean restaurant, nice decor.  This place scored tied for highest on our informal Thai taste test!  Their yellow curry is unbeatable, and I was happy that they recently added brown rice as an option.  Their prices are really reasonable.

The only item that didn't rank among the best on our informal taste test was their Tom Ka Gai soup (we've had better).

They got really good scores (99, I think) from the restaurant health inspections, which is nice.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The Golden Bags are right up there with The Balls. It may sound strange & even a little crass, but you've got to ignore the names. You won't regret it or my name isn't Jamie D!
author: Amy D.

description:
I've only been to Regent Thai twice, but I can easily say that I like it better than most Thai options on the Peninsula. The food doesn't taste as greasy as Marnee Thai, which is two thumbs up from me. 

I've only tried yellow curry ($7.25) from Regent, but mmmm, it's good. I've always been partial to pad thai ($6.95) or pad see ew ($6.95), because I like it and it's a typical dish that you can't go too wrong with; both are good at Regent. Also consider trying chicken satay and the samosa-like fried pouches called Golden Bags. 

Prices are really reasonable here. Lunch dishes vary from $5-6 and the portions are very generous. Even off of the regular menu, you can have an entree, soda and dessert for under $15. I'm glad I don't live or work near Regent, because if I did, it would be really bad.
author: Amy D.

description:
Unlike any other Thai restaurant in San Francisco, Regent actually made their food somewhat spicy for me.  Not quite as potent as I would have preferred, but good.  What allowed them to earn a fourth star was the selection of peppers that they will bring to your table upon request and which allowed me to kick the curry up a notch or two.  I had ordered Panang Neua (beef), which is my baseline Thai curry, and it was little watery compared to what I would normally enjoy, but it included a tasty assortment of fresh-cooked vegetables, so I was willing to be forgiving.  In addition, the appetizer we ordered, the stuffed fried chicken wings, was simply outstanding, and the service was good.  The kitchen screwed up my order (brought me shrimp instead of beef), but the error was rapidly corrected.

Overall, I'd probably give this place 3.5 stars, but it's still better than most Thai food I've had in SF.
author: Bitter J.

description:
Lunch specials are great and inexpensive (less than 10 bucks). Service is quick and courteous. Food is simple and definitely not your 'rich' Thai food. The location is spacious to accommodate large parties and has a pleasant ambience.

I have also done a take-out which worked great.
author: Maneesh S.

description:
I live about 2 blocks from this place and therefore am a frequent visitor (both eat-in and take-out).  The food is great, the prices are great, and the portions are more than great.  Those of you that complained about small portions must be giant humans... cause I have yet to finish a meal without leftovers!

Faves:
- Coconut chicken soup. yummmmmmmmmm. 
- Red curry... go Thai hot and it is serious
- The delish cucumber salad that comes on the side with Chicken Satay.  I could eat pounds of it if they would give it to me. 

Also- one Saturday around 7 I came in with a slightly inebriated group of 10 or so, and they had no problem setting up a large table for us.  They were even gracious when our noise level went from a 2 to a 10 as will sometimes happen after a full day of ferrying and drinking at Sam's.
author: Meagan C.

description:
Nasty, nasty, and more nasty.

Small portions and nasty.

Forgot to say it's nasty!
author: G J J.

description: Love Regent Thai! I'm a huge Thai fan and this is my favorite Thai place in the city. Always delicious with wonderful seafood options. The tom ka soup is so wonderful. It's a great value for such delicious food!
author: Shara M.

description:
Always delicious, and while sometimes the wait staff is a bit harried, they are always super nice and sweet.

The Golden Bags are deeelish, and the Pad Thai is among the best I've ever had. The Gai Pad Khing (chicken w. ginger) is so yummy and a healthier option. The lunch specials are great deals. A great local Thai!
author: Brooke H.

description:
I have been to Thailand and am a Thai food picky! 

The Pad Thai was just okay but they compensated for having authentic Thai beer. 

My two guests seemed to enjoy their food enough to not leave leftovers. 

The bathroom really feels like Thailand with flowers in the water. I loved that touch about my trip and appreciated it here at Regent Thai. 

The service was pretty good. 

Nothing really stood out in terms of bad or good so if I were in Noe Valley again and I was hungry for Thai then I think I would go back.
author: Vanessa y.

description: Started off with golden bags. They were good, but I would've preferred more potato-based filling and less fried wrapping. I wasn't a huge fan of the tom yum gai soup, but I'm not a big fan of sweet and sour soups to begin with. We ordered gaen garee gai (chicken yellow curry), pad se-ewi, and a beef dish recommended by our server. All three dishes were pretty decent, nothing spectacular.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I grew up in the bay area eating Asian food. Regent Thai is one of the best Thai food in San Francisco (maybe even THE BEST). It's consistently high quality, too.

We've added this restaurant to our regular rotation of places to eat and do take-out about 3 times a month. We've tried many dishes and have never gotten a bad one... ever.

Whenever we have visitors to SF who want to eat out, we go here. Everybody has loved it.

"G J J" wrote a 1 star review, but he must have this place confused with a different Thai place?
author: Tom N.

description:
i have lived in various parts of the mission/glen/bernal -and this is the best thai, hands down - not sure how long it's been there, but i have been eating here for abt 7 yrs and the food is fresh, delicious and the service is excellent.  even though they offer take out, my husband and i often dine there because it is a nice little relaxing spot (and those deep fried things they give you when you first arrive are soooooo yummy).  the waitresses are always dressed nicely and it is really great to eat in a place where the staff have obviously so much pride in their business.

we went to thailand a year ago and of course now consider ourselves thai food snobs.  regent thai has the unique ability to really cater to everyone,  - they clearly use fresh ingredients and spices and if you ask for it spicy, they don't pussyfoot, it is damn spicy.  and did i mention the prices - totally reasonable (i hope they don't read this and increase them).  the biggest bargain in the area in addition to being to best food.

the other two thai places closest to where i live in bernal - pad thai on mission- AWFUL and blue elephant on cortland - just ok.  walk the few extra blocks for regent, you won't be disappointed!
author: O B.

description: I've never had any problems with this place. The food is usually pretty decent and not too greasy. The prices aren't the greatest, but I suppose that's to be expected.
author: William M.

description:
I did not expect anything from this place in Noe Valley.... and I was wrong. The food is fresh, tasty, with a lot of variety. It's basically the best thai place I've had in San Francisco so far (and I have been to many places).

Also.... it is pretty cheap. The location and atmosphere is not fancy and more neigborhoody than anything else. Not a date place...unless your date is serious about eating good thai food ;-)
author: Pascal L.

description:
For some reason, I always headed left from my house to eat Thai food on Mission street, but I recently turned right and ended up at Regent... I will always turn right for thai!  

You can order just a cup of Tom Kha Gai, which I really appreciate.  Some places make you order the entire bowl, which is too much.  I like to order the soup and the papaya salad, and my eating companion usually gets a noodle dish. 

We have started going about once a week, which i'm totally into.  Maybe they can change the music?  It's soft rock, muzak style. no thanks.
author: Emliy H.

description:
great Yello Curry Prawn!
I miss your Monterey Blvd. location and wish you would move back into the neighborhood.
author: Catherine D.

description: The food was absolutely delicious but unfortunately the food took a very long time and it was difficult to get our check and pay our bill.  I would have to agree with most of the other comments about how long it takes, next time i will probably just get it to go.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
I've been to Regent Thai numerous times and have NEVER been disappointed. The food is delicious!! I love their appetizers, my favs are golden bags and the combination satay. The entrees are all very yummy. 

This is definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.
author: Monica S.

description:
One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants in San Francisco.  I love Thai food, therefore....I love Regent Thai!  Great prices, friendly service, and lots of vegetarian options.  The food is always fresh and tasty.  We usually order to go, but it's a treat to eat in since this place is so laid back, clean, and comfortable.  

The pad thai is fab, as is the tofu pad ma kuer (amazing eggplant dish) and tofu gra prow (tofu w/ green beans, snow peas, chili, garlic, and sweet basil).  Also, you've got to try the "golden bags" (don't be afraid...they are delicious, I swear).  They are one of the tastiest vegetarian appetizers around.  

We take out-of-towners there and they always rave about it!
author: Abby W.

description:
I ordered take-out from here on a friday night. The staff worked quickly, were very courteous, and packed the order very well (no spillage). 

The food overall was so-so, the Papaya Salad didn't really pop with flavor.
The Tom Ka Gai, was bland looking and tasting, it seemed like it should of had more variety of ingredients.
The Pad Kee Mao (Beef) was a small portion and had a lackluster sauce, the beef was not of good quality.

I did like the Red Snapper with chili sauce, it had a nice spicy-sweet flavor but once again I felt like the portion was lacking.

I'd prefer to go to Narai or Thep Phanom instead.
author: Issa K.

description:
For years I've loved Regent Thai at their 29th Street location, and before that at their original Monterey Blvd home.  My wife and I had some of our earliest dates at Regent, and my daughter counts it as one of her favorite restaurants anywhere.  So a review of Regent feels more like reviewing a family member, and that can be a little tricky.  But putting aside the personal warmth I feel towards this restaurant, I will don my hat of objectivity and assert Regent is a consistently excellent dining experience.

The Regent menu is comprehensive, but not excessive, and the result is a reasonable variety of dishes that are consistently well-executed.  My family tends to veer towards seafood and veggie dishes, and Regent excels at these.  Miang Kham is a great starter, with coconut, dried shrimp, lime and nuts wrapped together in lettuce leaves and served with a delicious savory-sweet sauce (my daughter also loves the Golden Bags).  Golden Salmon is a favorite entree, a mild yellow curry sauce and vegetables together with a perfectly cooked salmon fillet (the Ginger Salmon is also quite good).  Another standout and perfect pairing for the Golden Salmon is Tofu Gra Prow, with sauteed tofu with green beans, red pepper, and basil in a medium spicy sauce.  There are numerous beef, chicken, and duck entrees, and they are particularly adept at preparing duck, which is always tender and juicy.

Service is gracious, efficient, and very friendly.  The place is often busy, but it's the rare occasion when the kitchen takes more than a few minutes to turn around an order.  Even rarer is the case when they make a mistake, although there have been times when they replaced an unwanted dish for an error *I* made.

Prices are extremely reasonable, with higher end dishes topping out around $10, and many veggie selections in the $6-8 range.  The dining room is somewhat loud, but very pleasant and comfortable, with warm wood floors and an open, airy feel to the place.

I dined at Regent last night with on old friend and two new acquaintances, none of whom had ever been there.  The objective consensus from the unbiased first-timers was Regent is a winner on all counts (quality, price, service).  How nice.
author: Hugh B.

description: Regent Thai is a great little Thai place in the Mission.  Very affordable with a eclectic menu, this place is what most Thai places should be.  They serve good portions with the right amount of heat.  The chicken and beef are of great quality with no chewy pieces.  They offer brown rice and fresh veggies.  The Thai Spicy Wings are good and they dish up a mean Tom Yum as well.
author: Andy Z.

description:
Tasty, cheap thai food in a casual atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and prompt. The food was as good, if not slightly better than any other Thai food I've had in SF (or anywhere actually). We ordered Pad See Eiew, Pad Thai, and a DELICIOUS beef curry (the first one on the menu under curries, I can't remember the name).

The only bad thing was the funky fried styrofoam things they bring you when you're first seated. Weird.
author: Audrey N.

description:
Plus - authentic tom yum gai. I am glad they don't bastardize it with onions. 

Minus - not enough spice.
Tacky servers.....a woman with wavy hair asked us, as she refilled our tea, if we needed change back after paying our bill.  We said no, please keep it, that was our tip.  She asked AGAIN, 'you don't need $3 back?'  (it was actually $3.75) with haste and eyes bulging.  We said no, please keep it.  She ABRUPTLY stopped refilling our tea cups and walked away in a huff and started speaking thai very loudly and angrily to her coworker.  She obviously expected a larger tip.

We gave a 15% tip, what was her problem?  Rude to farang.  This is a neighborhood spot, they should be nice to the neighbors.
author: Yelper H.

description: We came here for lunch just the other day and had a decent enough time. We we were running a little close to when they close in between dinner so service was kind of missing. I only had a singha and some Vegetarian Phad Thai - both were ok. Nothing really stuck out to me as amazing. I wasn't full when we left either. Oh well, I would go back....just not racing to get there. I'll stick to Ploy II
author: Jena D.

description: Everything we ordered we enjoyed. I don't remember the proper names of the dishes, but we had fried tofu that was amazing, mussman beef curry that starred a delicious slow-cooked beef roast, red and yellow curries that were both very creamy and flavorful, and a spicy beef dish that was high quality as well. I'm from the south bay and have always considered Thai Pepper to be the best Thai food that I judge all others by, and this held up and is now my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Do yourself a favor and give it a try!!
author: Mike M.

description:
I'm addicted to Regent Thai. It's just so good, so cheap, so speedy, and even though there's always customers around, it never gets too crowded. 

The girls do a great job at delivering a good service - And you just know these servers work hours on end, continously, because it's always a busy place and it's always the same 4 or 5 ladies.

Veggie options galore, spiciness level somewhat manageable (there's no way of making something that's spicy comepletely non-spicy, unfortunately), and my meat-loving friends have always been satisfied as well.

There's no delivery, but you can ask for take-out. It rarely takes them over 10 minutes to have it ready.

Anything else? Nah. If you're in the area, just go. There's virtually no other thai options, but who needs them when this one place is so good?
author: Jorge C.

description: Made a reservation a few days ahead - wise to do so because it can get really busy and it's a small restaurant.  Food was good, as always - don't miss their special prawns over noodles and their stuffed chicken wings.  They always start with complementary shrimp chips.
author: Jay S.

description: I'm not a big fan of Thai food but I do enjoy it on occasion when I'm want a change of pace in the foods I eat.  I had the Pad Se Eiw with beef.  It was good food.  The portion was perfect for lunch.  This was my second time here so I kind of new what this places was all about.  I think I need to come back here at try the Thai BBQ.  Now that's something that sounds delicious to me!
author: Brent T.

description:
Food is good, service is great (they even closed a window for us), the decor is 'eh', but overall was nice.

I would go here for a casual dinner with people that you know and love.
author: Girls Named Cherise C.

description: Order the duck curry!!!! It is one of the most delicious meals I have had in recent memory.  The papaya salad is also the best I've had. They have a wonderful crispy pan-fried tofu dish with chilies that is unique and so tasty. And it is so inexpensive!  Just go there and eat to your heart's content without pangs of guilt.
author: Lydia B.

description: I've gotten takeout here and have been satisfied each time! The customer service is good and prompt (about 15 or 20 minutes for an order of food for 4 people), and very well priced, with most items on the menu coming in at 7 or 8 dollars. I also found that the food is less greasy and more "healthy" than most thai food I've had in the past. The veggie pad thai with tofu is my typical order, and they also have especially delicious brown rice available as a healthier alternative to white.
author: K. T.

description: Tried it for first time. Not bad, not terrific, just ok. Really reasonably priced ($39 bucks for app, two mains, thai ice tea and mango sticky rice and that figure includes 20% tip). Servers weren't particularly friendly but were attentive. Nothing wrong with this place but the food wasn't memorable. I live up the hill in Bernal and I think I'll stick with Pad Thai on Mission.
author: Ben L.

description: Our first meal at Regent Thai was dinner Saturday night: good, but not on par with so many better Thai restaurants in town. It's probably an OK neighborhood spot, but not worth making a trip, as we did, based on the good reviews here. The staff was pleasant, not always attentive, but nice. Twice I flagged another waiter to help us out when I couldn't get our waiter's attention. Double cooked duck was pretty uninspired for one of their chef's specialties and I guess they didn't believe we'd enjoy it spicy as was requested. The chicken curry was flavorful, and medium spicy had absolutely no kick. Broccoli and mushrooms was bland and most was left uneaten. Our check came as a total without a breakdown on the individual items. I asked for one and it took about 10 minutes to get it. Decor is pleasant. But the food and service weren't so hot.
author: Donald O.

description:
This is one of the more solid eateries off of Church Street, which is saying something. It is literally a block away from my apartment, and I have had it numerous times as both take-out and eat-in. (I've even considered rigging up a convenient can-and-string telephone line, or honing pigeon ordering system.)

The food is pretty good. Virtually everything my girlfriend and I get there is delicious, and the guests we've taken were equally pleased. I find the portions adequate and I'm a fairly large guy with a decent appetite. I highly suggest starting out with the Tom Kha Gai soup--it's a soup made with coconut milk, chicken, lemon grass and bamboo shoots. 

The waitresses are very friendly and if you go there enough, the servers will remember what you like and you'll feel monotonous and embarrassed. A fun game to play is: How Long Will My Glass Sit Before It Is Filled With Water Again? So far my high score is eighteen seconds. They love to hydrate you. 

The décor is a mix of an eccentric Taiwanese sitcom and the line for Space Mountain. That probably sounds like a bad thing, but it's not.
author: Devon D.

description: Love the food!! Im not a big fan of Thai food but i would definetely swing by again to have their curry again. My tolerance for Thai food is only up to the mild yellow curry and the one they gave me from the chefs special is just...perfect. The place is pretty nice too, it was filled with artsy thai decorations and there was lots of lightnings. It suits both for family dinners or dates:)
author: Cavin T.

description: Lunch is a bargain.  Dinner can be pricey.  I usually get the yellow curry chicken and I've never been disappointed.  Other dishes have always hit the mark as well and we don't have any leftovers since we eat it all!
author: Karen C.

description: Solid, local Thai - and worth a trip for people outside Noe. More green curry?  Yes, please.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Wonderful neighborhood restaurant.  The dining area seems to always have 'just enough' diners to not feel 'empty,' but it's never too noisy.  Mostly frequented by locals.

Their prices are incredibly decent and the place is impeccably clean.  Presentation of their dishes are simple, but you can't help but feel like great care was taken in ensuring a clean, simply elegant display.

The staff are super-friendly - and my water glass never ran empty.  None of the dishes we ordered were heavy in oils or texture.  The portions are a bit minimal, but it just forced us to order more different dishes to satisfy our appetite.  Plus, with their prices, you can have a budget-savvy meal w/dessert.
author: Olma M.

description: Fried red snapper filet with red chili sauce... hands down one of the best Thai dishes I have ever had.  Totally reminds me of a dish I had on the street outside the royal palace in Bangkok - make sure to ask for it "really spicy" to get the true feel for this wonderful dish.  Everything else I've had from here has been above par takes on Thai standards familiar to most of us Americans.  I can definitely recommend pretty much any of their seafood dishes and they do my favorite rendition of spicy eggplant with chicken and basil.  I've done both sit down and take out from here many times... absolutely adore this place.  Best Thai in my 'hood, in my humble opinion.
author: Chris P.

description: I probably shouldn't admit this, but I eat Regent Thai food at least once a week. There are other thai restaurants in the neighborhood, but this is the place that has consistent quality, abundant veggies, identifiable chicken, and brown and jasmine rice. Also, the prices are comparatively low for what you get. I have dined in a few times and the service is great. This place is really kid friendly, and I'm not, so I usually get my food to go. If I place my order in person, they offer tea or water, which is a nice courtesy.
author: Kely G.

description:
Truly one of the better Thai restaurants in town, in a town with quite a few good Thai restaurants.  

The space is really nice, the staff are accomodating and it has the kind of feel that you could sit there for hours and catch up with friends and not be rushed out.
author: Sean S.

description: Great food and service. Went in with my brother who just moved to the area and dropped in without any expectations. Loved the food and even through I had no idea what I was ordering before hand, we both enjoyed great dishes with complimentary "chips and sauce." Very friendly staff and quick service and not very expensive either. Highly recommend it and will stop by again when visiting that neighborhood.
author: Isabel F.

description:
I really enjoy this place. The atmosphere is very nice.  Although it's casual, it has a very elegant, more upscale feel than some of the places I've been to.  I like the fresh roses too.  The food is very good, as is the selection.  I don't like Thai that is too spicy, and this is just right.  The prices are very reasonable also.  
The service can be a bit slow, but overall, the staff is very friendly and hospitable.
author: Barbs J.

description: I'm so glad this place is within walking distance from my house!  It's where we eat for a lazy night when we don't feel like cooking and it's also where we've taken friends and family when they're in town.  We've never had a bad dish there, but our favorites include the roast duck over spinach, the grilled squid, the fried whole pompano, and their minced chicken with basil.  The service is also always great -- everyone seems genuinely happy to be there and to see you.
author: Carlo A.

description: Don't know anything about a lot of people's review on bad service, but every time I go (which has been probably once a month for two years) the waitresses are always kind and never have any attitude. We always bring visiting family here and they always love it! Recently I've been expanding my meal choices and still everything is DELICIOUS. My favorite appetizers are the golden bags and the chicken satay. The pad kee mao is also really tasty and the gai regent/pad gra prow chicken plates are amazing! Still my favorite Thai in the bay no doubt.
author: Mared H.

description:
Holy Christ! And I say this because I went there on Easter, when it was the only place open. How did I miss this joint? I've lived in the neighborhood for years and never noticed it when I walked by, never heard anyone talk about it. Was everyone keeping it secret? Does it get crowded on non-Holy Days?

All I can say is: service superb, noodles awesome, and I'm dying to go back. Wish they delivered.
author: Tim B.

description:
Regent Thai is yummy. There is plenty on the menu so deciding what to order took us a while because we were both hungry. Finally settled on the  following: 

1. #31 GAENG GAREE GAI (We loved this dish; mild green curry with coconut milk so it's just the right balance of spice and sweet. Couldn't stop eating this stuff but managed to so there would be leftovers and let me tell you this stuff was good two days later!)

2. #74 NUER YANG (Good but nothing special)

3. #88  PAD SE-EIW (This is my favorite Thai dish. It's something about those wide noodles and the sauce that I absolutely L-O-V-E. I was pleased that Regent Thai does this dish well.)

Now they serve these air puff things with this sauce while you are waiting and let me tell you-I don't know what those things are made of but they are surprisingly addictive.

Service was a little slow at times (they were busy) but servers were friendly. The portions sizes are generous and it's inexpensive.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
A nice neighborhood Thai restaurant.

Food was delicious - the mild curry was not very spicy, which was great for my toddler's palate. I ordered the golden salmon - salmon in a red curry with thai basil and veggies - deelish! The salmon was perfectly cooked and moist to perfection. I was hoping to take some home so that I could pack it for lunch the next day, but unfortch, I finished it off it was so good.

Service was good and the staff were very friendly.

Worth coming back to...
author: Kelly R.

description: This is being written after only one visit, yet I sampled a few dishes, none of them were very good.  I've had much better Thai food elsewhere.  I found the ingredients to be a bit sub par- to tofu dish I tried was very dry, the chicken dish was fatty with a funny taste. I couldn't finish either one.  Even the soups were just meh.  The only yummy thing I had was the iced tea, which is pretty hard to mess up.  I'm disappointed because I love Thai and just moved a block away.  I'll be heading elsewhere when I get a hankering for delicious Thai cuisine!
author: AJ L.

description: i got the spicy fried chicken wings. super bomb, commenting to say you should get those.
author: Marsha H.

description: Fantastic. Insanely cheap too, especially for the quality. Service stellar.
author: Paul N.

description:
Regent Thai is the perfect place to go when the fog rolls in over Twin Peaks and you feel like a warm bowl of soup or spicy curry to warm you up.

Favorite dishes: yellow curry prawn, the duck special with crispy basil, and the green curry.  Plus, they give you the option of brown rice instead of the usual white rice.

Consistently good; friendly service; generous portions; not much ambiance, but the place is clean and tidy.
author: hillary h.

description:
One of the things I love about Noe Valley is all the quaint little restaurants you can dip into. Regent is really cute and I love the waitresses matching uniforms/outfits and the way they serve rice. Hey, it's the little things! They're not always the most attentive, but the food makes up for it. 

BEST Tom Yum soup. I might just have bad luck, but unlike a lot of other Thai places they actually cut the stems off the mushrooms! Imagine that. Yellow Prawns are the next best thing at Regent. Now I've had better Pad Thai, but I've also had worse. It's a draw on that one. The Butterfly Prawns are very misleading, they sound wonderful and taste awful. I want to like them so much that I've actually tried them three times! Each time was worse than the last.

Despite a few misses which are bound to happen in any restaurant (especially Thai), Regent is pretty far up on the pecking order. Plus, it doesn't have that 'chain feel' that I despise so much.
author: Vanessa P.

description: I've brought many many friends, acquaintances here-I'd venture a guess and say at least 100 over the years and have NEVER had any one say they were disappointed-in fact most claimed the food was the best Thai food they'd ever had. Great authentic service, reasonably priced and excellent food. I don't go anywhere else for Thai food.
author: mary n.

description:
This place is alright.
The staff is extremely nice.
Go there if you are too tired (or cheap) to go to Marnee thai in the outer sunset and live in Noe Valley (i.e. if you are like me).
author: Bobby T.

description:
After months of driving past this place on our way to Alice's, we finally tried it last week.  And, we've already been back.

The staff, in traditional dress, is extremely friendly and attentive.  And, the food is quite good.  Nothing earth shattering or out of the ordinary but definitely good-bang-for-your-buck Thai food. 

The Nuer Pad Broccoli (#48) is really good and flavorful and so is the Mod Gra Tiam Prik Thai  (#52).
author: Jeff P.

description: We consider ourselves super fortunate that our favorite Thai place in the city is within walking distance in our neighborhood. The service and food are great. We often will pick up to take home as well as take friends and family there for a casual lunch or dinner. Try the Chef Special prawn dish (first on the menu in that section). Also the Regent Thai Chicken, Cashew Chicken and Yellow Curry are delicious. Spring Rolls are a great app. Everything we've tried we've liked. The quality of the meat and the sauces can't be beat for a local neighborhood restaurant.
author: Artina M.

description: prob best thai place in Noe....the flavors are well developed and when they say spicy, they mean it!  the flavors are authentic and not watered down.  the green curry is delicious!
author: Nisha K.

description: Great go to Thai place- I swear the pla sam ros (fried snapper) is addictive as are the yellow curry and tom kha soup. Big menu with plenty of options, very prompt service and always served with a smile! Hope i never live too far from Regent!
author: Molly C.

description:
In a city where thai food seems to be on every block. With options like king of thai noodle 1 -454654 and the osha's that open up everywhere every two months, this by far has been my favorite. I use regent thai as the resto for special occasions and warm fuzzy yumm yumm sleepy time feelings in my tummy. 

As a matter of fact... I'm calling them now!
author: danny e.

description: We wandered in here for lunch since all the brunch places in the neighborhood were packed, and we were pleasantly surprised. Nice presentation and decent food for the money. Most items were under $10, and the wait staff was nice. I had the duck rice plate, which was nothing special, a little plain, and had some of my boyfriend's Pad Thai, which was tasty. We also got the Golden Bags as appetizers - they're okay, mainly just amusing to look at. It was a pleasant experience; I'd go back.
author: Jin Z.

description: Excellent red curry chicken and great service! Also lots of vegetarian options. There are 25-30 lunch specials for around $6.00. Will be back often
author: Kurt H.

description:
for a neighborhood restaurant, it's pretty good. I think some of the 4-5 stars reviews are a bit exaggerated, though. 
Not a super-star rest, but good, especially if you live in the area (I would not recommend people to cross the city to eat there)
author: Lucas G.

description: Have been meaning to go here ever since I moved into the neighborhood.  It would have gotten five stars (excellent food, great price, cute location), but the wait staff was meh. So disappointing, since I did like everything else.  I'll be back in the hopes that they prove that this was a fluke.
author: Adam T.

description: This is probably my favorite restaurant in the neighbourhood. My husband and I eat here at least twice a week. It's as close to perfect as I could ask for. Cheap, tasty, huge menu, super nice ladies working here. The food is superb, and we've had almost everything on the menu. The whole fried fish with garlic chili sauce is to die for, and costs less than $10. Fantastic. Thank you Regent Thai for delicious food and great service!
author: Troinex C.

description:
Attn Fellow Yelpers:  this restaurant has the best curries in the world.  How do I know?  Every time I've had Thai anywhere, ever, it doesn't live up to Regent Thai.

great:   Tom Ka Gai, Lemongrass beef, green/yellow/red curry, pad thai.

bad: eggrolls but who cares!

Service is exemplary.

The owners are fantasticly nice and kind.


Long live Regent Thai!
author: J H.

description:
One of our favorite places to go for Thai food. Very good wide noodles and curry. We used to get takeout at least once a week from Regent.  Very pleasant people working there and never had issues with the service.

Must try!
author: Kantancerous I.

description: Thai restaurants are ALL over the place in San Francisco, but they are very hit or miss.  Regent Thai is consistently excellent.  I haven't had a bad meal here.  Mostly I do take-out, but even dining in is a great experience.  Try their "golden bags", it's yummylicious wrapped in crispy dough.  Love their green curry too.  When I walk in to place a take out order, they always offer me some jasmine tea while I sit and wait.
author: Nolwenn S.

description: Loved it!  I brought my two young girls and the staff was helpful.  The food was really good and the service was perfect.  They were kind and available but not pushy or too fast.  The prices are reasonable.  ($8 corkage is unheard of these days.)
author: Larry W.

description:
Used to be one of my favorites, but no more. Oh no. The quality of ingredients has slipped and the service is now brusk at best.  The meat is tough and the presentation of the "to go" food is sloppy and down right unappetizing. What happened? Let us hope that this restaurant owner rethinks cutting corners and buying inferior cuts of meat as a business strategy.

The harried staff barely has time to take your order on the phone and several times, I got home and found part of the order missing or some other dish was in the bag instead of what I ordered. You have lost my business folks.
author: carme ng e.

description:
This is, by far, the best "Thai restaurant" for me.Since i've been in San Francisco, I had visited like 8-9 Thai restaurants around (Regent Thai is first ever) but non after this place came out better.Regent Thai even better than Thai restaurant in Thailand.I mean the taste, prices, quality of foods , atmosphere and services are actually better but due to the limited space, sometimes(around 6PM - 9PM) this place is crowded and very busy, hard to get a table and force you for to-go order.I wanna give it 4 1/2 but I can't so im gonna give it 4 instead of 5, since there is no "PERFECT" restaurant right ?? :)
P.S. I love Regent Thai's PAD THAI
author: SuShiLoveR I.

description: Maybe I'm just spoiled, being from Australia, but this is very average Thai food... The price just saves it from 2 stars.
author: David E.

description: Good eats. Vegetarian friendly, probably even vegan friendly, since they ask if eggs are okay. When they say spicey, they mean spicey. Service is exceptionally attentive. Space is rather small, as are the portions. Nevertheless, this place is worth visiting.
author: O. K.

description: I live a few blocks from this place.  After half a dozen takeout orders I've given up.  The spring rolls and every other appetizer we've tried have been mediocre at best.  And though my wife has liked a couple of their dishes, notably the yellow curry (her standard choice), I've been underwhelmed with all my selections.  But they stay busy, which has kept me coming back (thinking I'm missing something)... no longer though.
author: Matt C.

description: I don't understand how this restaurant can have so many good reviews. I have eaten Thai food in many places and what was served here was truly awful. First of all, the restaurant was freezing. We huddled in our coats throughout lunch. The cucumber salad and tom kha gai soup were edible, but the chicken curry and the pad thai were not only served mildly warm but were borderline disgusting. For the latter, the noodles were gummy, the veggies looked less than fresh, and the dish was without flavor. It's difficult to mess up pad thai, but Regent Thai managed to do just that. Perhaps this is a "you get what you pay for" situation: the restaurant is indeed very inexpensive. Again, I am puzzled by the plethora of favorable reviews and cannot possibly recommend the place.
author: Sandra S.

description: You know what?  I love thai food, a lot!  It's my favorite food in the world and yet when people ask me where to go, I struggle with an answer.  This place makes good pad thai, this place makes good curries.......Yesterday, we ordered 3 dishes at Regent Thai and they were all great.  To be honest, I had forgotten about this place but now that I am back in the neighborhood, I will not forget again.  I promise.
author: Andrea S.

description: Good place to go, parking's a little tough.. only streets. The food was wonderful. Sauteed mushrooms with garlic and broccoli!!! OMG and the chef special shrimp with noodles... you have to get the chef special.
author: Stefanie Y.

description:
I can't wholeheartedly recommend Regent Thai. Twice I have found that they included ingredients I was allergic to (seafood) but nowhere on the menu was that made clear.  

It was only after I started eating #53, a pork dish listed in the pork section of the menu, that I realized that there was some shellfish in the sauce. A phone call to Regent confirmed that there was indeed shrimp in the sauce and that other dishes on the menu similarly have seafood or peanuts in them and they don't make note of any of that on their menu.

So if you have any allergies, beware of Regent Thai. Otherwise, the food is great. :)
author: john a.

description: Super cheap, delicious Thai food. Yes you can find better Thai (this is San Francisco and it will cost you more then double), but their food is great. Plus you can't beat how inexpensive it is. The service has always been great when I've gone. It's a nice neighborhood spot that you'll never have to wait too long to get a table at.
author: Tony S.

description: I had kind of a crappy day today, and my takeout dinner from Regent Thai totally redeemed my day!  I had the yellow curry shrimp with green beans (from the specialties menu) and it was sensational, totally out of this world, couldn't have been more delicious.  And good friendly service, even for takeout.  I wish I lived closer to this place, I would go 5x per week!
author: Holly P.

description:
Rainy evening, Pomello's wasn't opened yet, we were going to have the curry at Pomello's anyways, so why not try Regent Thai, just one block away. 
We ordered the fresh Thai egg rolls as an appetizer, non-fried, because I had just eaten 4 servings of fried finger foods at my work's  x-mas party the night before. I know, cheap xmas party, and I supposedly work at one of the most profitable companies in the US. Go figure. Anyways, I had eaten my fill of fried foods the night before, so I didn't want fried egg rolls. So we ordered the fresh non-fried egg rolls. They were tasty, filled with fried(oops!) tofu, cucumber and other veggies and served with a dipping sauce.
We also ordered veggie red curry, which I requested medium spicy. When we got it, it wasn't very spicy at all. Maybe they thought we were wusses and couldn't handle the spice. But HEY! I'm Korean! I can handle the spice! Ever heard of kimchi? 'nuf said. 
We also ordered the pad kee maw, flat noodles, with tofu, veggies, basil and spice, and again we requested medium spicy. And again, not spicy at all. 
The servers were very friendly, efficient and attentive. The restaurant itself was nicely decorated, and we sat in the window, and got to watch all the Church street traffic on a rainy night. I'd definitely go again, especially because I think that this is only decent Thai place near us. 
Oh, but veggies/vegans beware, the complimentary chips and dip the restaurant provides before your meal are shrimp chips! 
Total bill with tip: about $30
author: Caroline C.

description: I went there only because my favorite Thai place was closed on that Wednesday. It was my B-day so I went there with a group of people. All together we ordered at least 15 different dishes and none hit me really as delicious. The worst of it all was the Pad Thai, seriously I had much yummier one at the SFSU Thai stand! I wanted to introduce Thai food to my family who never tasted it before, but they were not very impressed. Bummer! I should have taken them to SF State or rather postpone my B-day dinner for another day and go to my favorite Thai place in Bernal Heights. I won't come back!
author: Joanna S.

description: Delicious! Got the "bags of gold" as appetizers which were very good, and then one of the chef's specials (dont know which one) with beef - which was delicious. Close to home - so no difficulty in finding parking. The service is good. The place has a nice feel to it. We sat on the window at the intersection of 29th and Church - and I liked the view too of the trolley rolling by every so often.
author: Saquib P.

description: This is a really important restaurant to me. It is always impressive. Really great food in an unhurried lovely atmosphere. The eggplant, the soups, noodles, meat & meatless dishes and the chef's specials are all yummy and fresh. We go every month or so.
author: Richard S.

description: I think one of the best things about Regent Thai is the selection of rice.  You can get brown or white.  Sheer awesomeness.  Most places just give you straight up white rice, which is fine but for those health nuts, you have an option at Regent's.  The place was clean, the food was great, and the service was nice as well.  For the price, you get a decent amount and some to take home.
author: Dorothy S.

description: The staff was nice and prompt.  The food was not the greatest though.  Pretty bland and generic.  The egg roll appetizer we got had a weird aftertaste too.  We were going to go to Eric's and I really wished we had gone there instead.
author: Norman M.

description: My sister and I went here tonight for a late dinner and it was fabulous! This was our first time going here and the food was wonderful. It could get quite busy here but tonight wasn't too bad. The staff is very nice and very good about filling refilling your water or hot tea when needed. We had a curry dish, noodles with chicken, and an eggplant dish...all yummy! I would definitely come back here and try other items on the menu...affordable, clean, and friendly staff.
author: Mel P.

description: It's good. The high ceiling and the decor are nice, and the service is pleasant. Solid utility Thai restaurant.
author: Karsten P.

description: This place is really good. I stopped here for a lunch whilst in the neighborhood and was pleasantly surprised! My favorite dish, Rad Nah Talay, was done up great. Friends I were with loved the yellow and green curries. The decor is very charming, and the staff is very friendly. A great spot for lunch... and at very affordable prices!
author: Jon N.

description: The food might be okay, but it is padded with nasty iceburg lettuce below, making dishes look fuller than they are. Curries were nothing special, neither were noodle dishes.
author: Emily A.

description: I live pretty much across the street from this place and it is my go-to for any night I don't have dinner figured out. Food is good, people are really nice, service is quick and professional. Bonus points: one of my favorite things is totally free! The "chips and dip" they serve are delish! I also love #80 the fried tofu with green beans and snap peas, and the red and yellow curry. I am not a huge pad thai fan, but it is pretty good here. I also love that they offer brown or white rice (or both!). Another great thing about this place, leftovers are even better the next day!
author: Tara T.

description: Not necessarily a destination restaurant, but it fits the bill for neighborhood take-out. We do takeout from Regent several times a month, and it's always been solid.
author: Lee S.

description: I used to live close to Regent and, if I still did, would go all the time. I was back in the hood this week and grabbed take out. They are such a great place to stop in for food to go, but I have to say the food wasn't as good as I remember it. I go to Marnee Thai or Silver Spoon, out in Inner Sunset and West Portal now, and I think both are better.
author: Shoshana D.

description: There's little variation between the majority of Thai restaurants in the City.  Of course, some are better than others, and I'd say Regent's one of the better ones.  Occupying a corner spot on Church St, the location is right off the J line.  I liked their lunch selections, and portions are generous for the price.  Service is quick and friendly.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Good, clean, solid Thai food with great service...we eat here all the time
author: Reza E.

description: I think this is a great Thai restraunt.  The food is very tasty and there is quite a large variety.  Some of my favorites are the Golden Salmon, Veggie Delight, and the veggies mixed with golden curry.  They offer quite a few vegetarian options as well.  The service is very good and efficient.  The prices are quite reasonable.
author: Jessica B.

description: Yummy food but small portions.  I would go there more often, but my boyfriend could eat both our servings & there wouldn't be anything for me.  I've had their Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, and Yellow Curry Chicken which were all very good, but we ate it in 5 bites... (not really, but you get my drift)
author: Christine O.

description: This place is right down the street from my house, which is both quite awesome and quite dangerous.  The food is consistently good, the people are very friendly, their prices are totally reasonable, and the service is awesome.  I recommend the green curry and the pad thai.  You can't go wrong.
author: Carrie O.

description: We went here once when we first moved to the neighborhood, and it was just "OK."  We went back about a month ago craving some Thai food, and it seemed like the place had been "upgraded."  The decor looks a little nicer, the food and service are good, and the prices are reasonable.  Very good neighborhood Thai food, and maybe worth the drive if you aren't lucky enough to have a reasonably priced, quality Thai food restaurant near you.
author: Erik C.

description:
We came here for dinner.
I guess you get what you pay for. The entrees are cheap, normally under 7 or 8 dollars. But then rice, at least brown rice, was another 3.50. The food was tasty, but not the best Thai food I have experienced. Service was great, and the staff was friendly. 

The meal starts with these really light, rice chips or something like that, which is accompanied with a very tasty dipping sauce. 

I got the Basil noodle dish, which was pretty good, but not amazing.

She got the Green curry, which was OK, but once again not as good as other green curries that we have had.

All in all, an alright experience, although I was hoping that it would be a little better. Seems just like I said that you get what you pay for. Great for the price, but not as flavorful as some other Thai food I have had. For middle of the road Thai food however, this place can't be beat considering the prices.
author: BW T.

description: It's not destination worthy, but it does go a step above your typical neighborhood takeout joint.  The food is consistent, the service is fast, and I'm really addicted to the yellow curry.  I wish things were a bit spicier (coming from someone who has little tolerance for true heat), but that doesn't stop me from coming back.
author: Nat K.

description: A Thai restaurant with a resort atmosphere: wood floors, white linen,  open spaces, and crisp decor. The food was also generously prepared and had an authentic taste. You need to come here.
author: Charm N.

description: i get takeout dinner and lunch here all the time. food is consistently good and reasonably price. HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Brad L.

description: I just love Regent Thai! I always forget how good and cheap it is. The interior is nice and clean, the people are friendly and the price is right. It's also fairly convenient from my neck of the woods, as long as you can find parking or have someone with you to run in and pick up your order.
author: Beth T.

description: Overall not too bad for a Thai Restaurant.  Great price, I had their red snapper dish, it's one of the seafood specials and it was very flavorful, light and definitely yummy.  The only thing that was kinda down for me was that service was kinda a bit rude, maybe cuz i went there for a bday dinner and it was a pretty big party but hey if oe's about to definitely get a tip, why be rude right?  s'all good though!  Ohh I nibbled on the roast duck dish, which was definitely tasty too and other seafood dishes were great!  GOOD place!
author: Ryan M.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant hands down up and down the Pacific Coast. This restaurant has excellent food, and excellent, professional service. The lady proprietors are genuinely pleasant and extremely hospitable. The Golden Bags are a treat, the curries are always satisfying, and their home made coconut ice cream is absolutely divine. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. We are lucky they chose San Francisco to establish their restaurant. I have been a happy customer ever since they were originally on Monterey Blvd., so for about 15 years now.
author: Eileen M.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. My favorite dish is the Prawns with Curry Sauce served on a bed of noodles. Although, everything on the menu is superb. The staff are friendly and the service is great. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Thai food at a decent price.
author: Lisa E.

description:
regent thai is a great dependable consistent restaurant.  friendly staff.  yummy dishes.  i especially like their panang pak and tom ka gai soup.  if you are in the mood for something more fried, their eggplant tofu is quite tasty too.  also they have an excellent coconut sticky rice dessert.  

i've never had to wait long.  their food is consistently good.  reasonably priced, especially for lunch time.
author: Jaz R.

description: I love Regent Thai.  I eat there about once a week for lunch.  And at $5.25 for a rice plate, it is a bargain!  Usually I order the Gaeng khiew warn gai with chicken and brown rice which is delicious.  I also like the kao mok gai (curried rice) with chicken.  The moo pad ma kuer (sliced pork with eggplant) is good but there doesn't seem to be enough of it on the plate.  The wait staff is always friendly and they recognize me -- they  even have my tea ready when I sit down!
author: Heather L.

description: I'm all about cheap thai food so based on the look of this place, clean nice decor, neighborhoody but not hole in the wall, I would have never walked in.  Luckily, I have a friend that lived right around the corner and forced me to try.  Overall, very decently priced and friendly service.  The best duck curry I've ever had and I'm a sucker for the prawn and scallops with eggplant.  Delicious!
author: SFFoodie F.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants, but also one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. They have good veggie options at very reasonable prices. My favorites are the tofu gra prow (tofu, chili and green beans) and pad kee mao (stir fried wide noodles), with no fish sauce.
author: Sam S.

description: They give you shrimp chips to start...I LOVE THAT.  The food is great, simple and cheaper than I expected.  The green curry is BOMB
author: Tim H.

description: Love this little bundle of greatness!  If you are a Noevalleyin and are looking for some good thai food at a reasonable price, try this place.  Their green curry is very tastey.  One of my favorite things to do is ride my scooter and pick up a few items to take home.
author: Cali Party Bus S.

description:
Excellent food. This restaurant can get very busy at times. The staff is a bit rude, but the food is worth it.
The golden bags are a the most delicious appetizer- they're kind of like light samosas. The golden prawns are also amazing for a main course- curry giant prawns. Everything is good.
author: N L.

description:
i wish i could give 3.5 stars.  nothing to complain about and you get exactly what you pay for.  very cheap, almost all dishes under $10.  The coconut chicken soup is amazingly delicious.  sort of my go-to cheap reliable thai place and worth the walk up to noe from the mish.  perfect on a kind of foggy summer evening.

great service too.
author: Holly S.

description: I had this place recommended to me is the best Thai place in Noe Valley.  I tend to agree.  They have a fabulous menu, great prices, and the servers are very attentive.  I love a place who gives you spicy when you ask for spicy.
author: angela k.

description: Cheap, Cheap good Thai food.  I love it and its right next to my house.
author: Rob P.

description: This place has ruined my life.  Now I won't go to any other Thai Restaurants, I used to think it was hard to find a bad Thai restaurant but now they all don't live up to my regent thai expectations.  Their crunchy tofu is like no other, truly crispy with yum veggies, and their golden bags (a thai samosa) are the best in the world.  Non-fried foods also beyond the pale.  Sigh.
author: Joan S.

description: Amazing food for an amazingly low price. Easily the best Thai food I have had. About fifteen dollars per head and definitely worth it!
author: Matt F.

description: I like this neighborhood thai place. The food is consistently good :)
author: Shipra K.

description: Tasty lunch specials at excellent prices in a nice dining room with attentive service.  What more could you ask for?  Doesn't seem to be anything ground-breaking on the menu, and I can really only vouch for their lunch, but  over two visits, nothing has disappointed.
author: Erin b.

description: To-fu choo-ros (clap-clap-clapclapclap)!
author: Eric S.

description:
Regent Thai has coddled me through more than a few hung over mornings, the kind when breakfast (of spicy, caringly prepared Thai yummies) occurs at 2pm. Regent Thai has also always been there for me as a reliable and consistent lunch and dinner spot when I'm not hung over. There is never a line here for lunch and that warms my heart. Wide windows across the store front let in lots of natural light and the space is always clean. Real flowers add a nice tough to the nooks and crannies too. The staff is all super polite and attends to one's needs graciously. 
I always request my dishes spicy, even if they have a chili next to them, and Regent always serves it up good. Lunch specials (served on the weekends too) set you back about a five spot and are enough food to satisfy even a 6'4" boy hailing from the South East regions of our country. 
Regent merits a 4.75, I would give them five if they started using more dark chicken meats, as my lack of respect for dry poultry is no secret. Luckily, the rich savoriness of coconut milk helps it out in the curries.
author: Candice L.

description: I have been here a couple of times while visiting friends in the area. I really like the food and the overall experience is good. The staff was very nice and attentive. I had the Pad see ew and ti was quite tasty and the mangos and sweet rice are an absolute must! If mangos aren't in season get the sweet rice with coconut ice cream - YUMMY!
author: Kari S.

description: Though not at the top of my list for Thai restaurants in SF (good lord, how many thousands of them are there?), but a great deal for big portions and nicely prepared dishes. All the curries are knockouts. Wish they and more restaurants would offer brown rice. Sigh.
author: Eric P.

description: Decent Thai food at decent prices.  Nothing particularly unique but I'm not a huge Thai fan, either.
author: Kevin S.

description: Wide selection of dishes, but it isn't the best I've had.  Spicy is lacking the kick that most Thai restaurants give as we asked for extra spicy with 2 dishes.  The desserts weren't sweet.  Sweet is what desserts are supposed to be all about.  I will agree with the clean and inviting decor and their Thai Tea is one of the best in SF (my regular Sunday fix after church).  It's good to see thai tea in it's original color and not bright orange.
author: Jason A.

description: This is where I go when I'm in need of a little Thai comfort food - typically on a Fri or Sun night, when all you want to do is sit on the couch and vegge. The red curries are very tasty, and while servings have gotten a little smaller over the last couple of years, they're still generous. Total noe valley neighborhood standby when you want something good, cheap, quick, and convenient.
author: beth l.

description: What's not to like?  Fast, friendly service.  Decent selection of dishes.  Reasonably priced.  In my neighborhood.  Delicious food.  No extra charge for white meat chicken (unlike some other, more expensive, Thai places).  Definitely a good choice, I'll be visiting here again.
author: Andy B.

description: I love Regent Thai. They are very clean and the staff is pleasant. The food is on the cheaper side and so delicious. Sometimes they take a long time to check up on you but that is rare.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Clean food, excellent and efficient service.  Highly recommended.
author: somel y.

description: yummy. unusual fresh spring rolls. different than the vietnamese inspired ones we're used to. very good.  delish green curry
author: Kimberly O.

description: What a gem. Fell in love with this place over 10 years ago when it was crammed into a renovated house over on Monterey. Although I miss the funkiness of old restaurant the cuisine at the new location is just as good, and cheap! You can always depend on getting great food here. Yum!
author: Natasha Anna A.

description: I like this place for the service and lunch prices. The staff is so nice, and it's nice see that they've stuck it out for longer than most businesses in the area. Once my mother commented that she liked the waitress's traditional Thai skirt and my father worked it out with them to get one for her for her anniversary.
author: Niki M.

description: Great food and decent prices. I actually order take-out from here quite often. I love their Pah Kee Mao and Tom Yum Soup. They're both excellent. Their lunch specials are pretty cheap. Of course, I'll keep going back.
author: Barney M.

description: This place has very tasty Thai food. I wish it were a bit closer to my house.   I'm not sure the food is as good as "Little Thai", but the atmosphere in the restaurant is better.
author: Meredith G.

description: This Thai food is clean and fresh, not super oily or fried.  Still, I think they could be slightly more generous for the money.  We have only gotten take-out, maybe the experience is more mindblowing eating in?
author: e w.

description: When I lived in Noe Valley, this place was one block away. Delicious and very reasonably priced food, coupled with friendly service. They also give you these crispy chip snacks in the beginning which is really nice. The staff is friendly. Very classy and comfortable feel. I gave this 5 stars because this is a place I would come to often, and the food/service was consistently good.
author: Prasant R.

description: Previous reviews are right on. To add: they have vegetables on the menu! And brown rice! It was nice to be able to order light without annoying the waitstaff.
author: J-Meoww W.

description: A hidden gem...as everyone living in SF knows, there are about a trillion Thai restaurants to choose from. We all have our fall-back favorites, but I cordially invite you to check out this place. It's "hidden" in fabulous Noe Valley. The food is yummy, service is excellent- very attentive, but not intrusive at all. They start you off on delicate shrimp chips with tamarind dipping sauce for every table, which is a clue that they are different than those other Thai joints. The curries, the fried noodles, the angel wings....all delicious! You know all the basic Thai dishes...well, they definitely do it right.  Perfect for both lunch and dinner. Very warm and cozy place. Parking is moderate to easy.
author: Miss Lili F.

description: This is our neighborhood Thai restaurant, and I'm so happy we have it!  I really like their food very much, and while some dishes could be spicier, the overall experience is great!  They have delicious yellow curry (gaeng garee gai #31) and yummy spicy noodles (pad kee mao #85).  Definitely give them a try!  Oh, and the appetizer, miang kham is so unusual and tasty!
author: Jenn K.

description: This is in my neighborhood. Very forgettable food. Not bad but far better options exist. I used to get takeout here years ago and it was ok then. It seems like it may have gone downhill since then. There's no real competition nearby, unfortunately. Makes me long for Osha Thai on Geary... but that's too far for walking.
author: Jason Y.

description: I agree with the general sentiment expressed thus far. The food is good. Not the best Thai in the city, but well prepared, fresh, and tasty. The prices are good and the service was attentive. Probably not worth making a special trip for, but for some tasty neighborhood Thai food, definitely a good choice.
author: Eater S.

description: I only tried the take-out from Regent Thai. The duck larb was excellent! I also liked the basil chicken and vegetable red curry, but found the pad thai to be dry and gummy. I would definitely check this place out again though, maybe eat in?
author: J. R.

description:
so many positives about this place.
lunch is relatively cheap (usually less than $6 per plate), although dinner is slightly more expensive (as in $2....seriously)

the food is a bit more refined and classy than other Thai restaurants- definitely not as greasy as some others.
AND one of our dishes came out with the rice in a star-shaped mold. gold star for that.
author: Sammy G.

description: Decent thai food - nothing too spectacular.  The yellow curry with beef was delicious.  Their special duck was a bit dry despite being very thinly sliced.  Sweet and sour chicken was ok - my only complaint about this dish was how big they made the pieces.  I thought it would be more manageable bite size pieces, but instead they were larger - 3-4" long and still on the bone.  Service was good.  I did notice that most dishes on the menu were under $10 - even some of the seafood entrees.
author: Jamie W.

description: Over the past few years, I think this has developed into the best Thai restaurant in Noe Valley proper (there are some good ones in the Mission, too, but if you want to stay in Noe, this is the place). The food is fresh, well-presented, and the wait staff is friendly and courteous, if not the most attentive. This has become my go-to spot in Noe for a quick Thai meal.
author: Glenn K.

description:
One of the best Thai places I've been to. Excellent service and very reasonable prices.

I unfortunately only remember two dishes, the pad thai and   Pla Dook Tod Grob, the last item on the menu. It was some sort of catfish and it was fantastic.

Highly recommended.
author: blimp w.

description: Regent Thai is a sweet restaurant.  Their waitstaff is kind and attentive and they accomodated 8 of us in prime dinnertime with no problem on a Saturday night.  Their curries are delicious, the pad thai is to die for, but the Tom Kha Gai was a little lackluster.  They have a decent wine selection, except that they're missing a Pinot Grigio which would definitely compliment their spicier selections.  I highly recommend their fried banana and coconut ice cream for dessert.  A pal in our group had a birthday, and they were very sweet in bringing out a complimentary Sangkhaya (custard) atop sweet sticky rice for her.  For Regent Thai: a straight A.
author: Devon P.

description: Great neighborhood option- fresh food, really friendly service and a nice environment.
author: JB S.

description: I dream of their Golden Bags, so tender yet crunchy and delicious.  Get thee to Regent Thai my friend, you'll love it.  Now I want a Thai Iced Tea.
author: Landy G.

description:
this place never disappoints me.
whether its for lunch or dinner, i can count on regent thai.
incredibly cheap and always good, and the waitresses have never let me down.
only "complaint" i have is the really cheesy music they play, but it's never too loud...so it's not bothersome.
i will come back many, many more times.
author: anett r.

description: Tasty food, good service, and reasonably-priced. I've tried a variety of dishes here - spring rolls, golden bags (super yum!), soups - all excellent, especially if you're getting over a cold, and almost every vegetarian dish available. They do the tofu perfectly - crispy, but not overdone, and the vegetables are always fresh and plentiful. A definite neighborhood keeper!
author: Shauna S.

description: Good food -- I only wish the portions were a little bigger.  I do love the shrimp chips they serve while you are waiting for your food.  It is just around the corner from my house, and the smell alone can make my mouth water.
author: Christie F.

description:
we picked regent thai for dinner because of the selection of dishes that were original to RT, and not your standard dish you could get at any thai restaurant.  initially we opted for delivery, but didn't mind driving to RT for a good take away meal (since they don't deliver).

our starter was the thai fresh rolls; rice paper rolls stuffed with pork, tofu, egg and cucumber, topped with crab meat.  i wish they had not cut the rolls up like pieces of sushi as the contents of the roll fell out.  i ordered #57, sahai ma kuer, which had prawns and scallops sauteed with eggplant, chili paste, yellow curry powder and green onions.  the dish was marked as spicy, yet it didn't have a hint of heat to it.  i was also unimpressed with the skimp portions of seafood, and over compensating with eggplant to fill the to go box.  it was a tasty dish, but for $10 i'd like to see more than 4 small scallops and 4 small shrimps (not prawns as the menu indicated).  he ordered #45 nuer kee mao, which was sliced beef with chili, garlic lemon grass, bamboo shoots and sweet basil.  again the dish was stated spicy, but it certainly was not.  he thought the dish was ok, but nothing to rave home about.

i don't think i'll be driving out of my way here for take away.   possibly if i was strolling in the area i'd pop in if i was jonesing for thai.
author: Sheri N.

description: I'm not thai, but I consider this my thai comfort food place. When I'm sick, when I'm tired, when I need some good warm curries, this is the place.
author: Fred A.

description:
Delicious! The Golden Bags are amazing, as is the Red Curry and Spicy Wide Noodles.

We've tried a few different Thai restaurants in the area but none compare, most don't even come close.

Though we do need to break out of the above routine, so if anyone has any other must try dishes to recommend, please do!
author: donna g.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai places ever! Discovered it when I was looking for food reasonably close to the Excelsior, and I'm so glad I did. I get take out here a couple times a month (sometimes more often) and I've loved every dish I've tried. I always get the tom kai gai coconut soup with chicken, some variety of curry (the green and red are my favorites), and either a stir fry or salad. If I'm in the mood for an appetizer, the golden bags are great, and sometimes I splurge for the coconut ice cream with friend bananas. I've never been disappointed with their dishes, and will continue to make this my stop when I'm in the mood for Thai comfort food.
author: Robin S.

description: No questions asked - my favorite Thai food in the city! I crave their "Tofu Choo Roos" (I'm sure I've mangled the name there, but it's in the Chef's specials). Great selection for vegetarians and meat-lovers, great portions at excellent prices. No complaints (ok, well - parking sucks but whatever) - I go here for dinner at least once a week :-)
author: What's in a nam e.

description: I actually look forward to paying my rent because across the street from the office is Regent Thai.  Every first of the month, I get a craving for their delicious Pad Thai (w/ shrimp). Other notable items are the Duck with Red Curry and the spring rolls. Yum yum. The have a great variety, so I find myself getting a different 2nd entree with my Pad Thai. Also good for takeout since I am a Noe Valley local. It's a nice walk down Church Street or hop on the J if you'd like. Delicious and accessible!
author: Ang F.

description: Love this place! Great food, good service, good prices. I used to live in the neighborhood, and it was perfect for a casual lunch or dinner. After moving out of the city, I still travel to Noe Valley sometimes just to eat here.
author: L G.

description: Everybody has their favorite Thai restaurant, but this is the best one close to my place.  They have excellent, and I mean outstanding, green curry at lunch for only $5.25 including rice (available for dinner too for a bit more).  This is one of the best, if not the best, green curries I've had outside of Thailand.  The red curry and pad thai are pretty good as well, but not quite as amazing, and the panang curry is only OK -- go elsewhere for better panang.  For dinner, the duck curry is really fantastic, up there on par with the green curry, and it's only $7.95.  Too bad it's not available for lunch.  The decor is quite nice, with a magnificent woodcarving.  Minus one star because not all the dishes are excellent (I'm still exploring), but if you stick to the green and duck curries, we're talking five star food at a great price!
author: Bill P.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go for a casual dinner.  Even though it gets a little loud inside, the atmosphere is really nice.  They have quick, ultra friendly service, reasonable prices, and absolutely delicious food.  You can't really go wrong with this place.
author: Kaitlin V.

description: Consistently good food - very flavorful and efficient service.  I always leave happy.  Local haunt for Thai food.
author: M W W.

description: All things considered...this is a decent restaurant but certainly nothing special.  My girlfriend and I ordered the chicken pad thai and the duck curry.  The duck curry was fairly tasty (and there was a good amount of duck) but the pad thai was less than inspired.  The pad thai was dry and seemed almost too sweet.  The service was fairly good, but then again the place was pretty empty.  We don't live in the neighborhood so we probably won't go back anytime soon.  But I could see how it could be decent takeout food if you lived close by.
author: Aaron D.

description: I am a huge Thai food fanatic. There are really only two or three Thai places that I swear by, and this is one of them. I enjoy the neighborhood, parking is adequate, and the service is PERFECT. While this isn't my favorite place for noodles, the appetizers and other entrees are satisfying and colorful. I absolutely adore the double-cooked duck (a la carte). The sliced duck rests on perfectly cooked spinach - never stringy (you know where the stem is still in your mouth and the leaf is dangling somewhere in your throat - NOT COOL), and is topped with crispy basil. The accompanying sauce is wonderful over your choice of rice - yet another reason to love this place - brown or white rice? I choose brown 'cuz mom did a great job at drilling the whole grain thing into my head and their rice is never overly chewy. Also good - golden money bags app., fresh spring rolls, pad Thai (though I like SF Thai BBQ's better), and the eggplant and pork dish. Like i said before, the service is rather astonishing - your water glass is never half-empty (or half-full for all you optimists out there) and your food comes before you start saying "Lord, I am  sooooooo huuuunnggry (like Lydia Bennett in A&E's Pride and Prejudice - if you know what I am talking about, I may be madly in love with you...). I could eat there once a week with ease.
author: Jessa B.

description: This is a cute place on Church street in Noe Valley. It's also very close to Mitchell's ice cream which puts it high on my list. After being seated we were served some deep fried rice cakes with a fishy tasting sauce. I wasn't a fan of the sauce, but it was nice to have something to munch on as we waited for the incredibly slow waitress to take our order. Apparently they thought that we had an additional person in our party so they didn't come by to take the order for about 30 mines despite our pleading. Once we finally convinced them that indeed, no one else was due to arrive, the service was fine. For appetizers we had spicy chicken wings with garlic, chili, and basil as well as deep fried yams with green beans and tofu served with a sweet peanut sauce and diced cucumbers. The wings were not bad, but not on par with those at Marnee Thai or Bui. The fried yams were very tasty. For our main courses we had pad si ew with chicken, sliced beef with chili, onions, and green peppers as well as a panang curry with shrimp. The beef dish was probably my favorite, the meat was tender and the sauce was delicious. The pad si ew was pretty good but the noodles could have been thicker. The curry flavor was allright but as I don't like shrimp, I couldn't eat that much of it. Overall I would give this place 3.5 starts. Not as good as Marnee or as innovative as Koh Samui and the Monkey but good nonetheless, and if you are in the area or making a trip to Mitchells, it's worth a try.
author: Kate A.

description: 3.5 Stars - This is one of those neighborhood gems. I liked the place, but I would never necessarily go out of my way to go here. Good thai food at reasonable prices, but nothing unusual or outstanding. I enjoyed the complimentary shrimp chips. We ate the double cook roast duck and tofu gra prow - once again, great dishes, but nothing that WOWed me.
author: Jeannette L.

description: My friends introduced me to Regent Thai.  I loved it.  Every dish tried was delicious.  From the Golden Bags, snappy green beans in Tofu Gra Prow to tender beef slices in Pra Ram Neur, the food, decor and friendly staff make this is a fine dining experience.
author: Mara O.

description: This is our family's favorite restaurant. Food is yummy and the service is excellent. The dishes are reasonably priced and the lunch menu is a steal. In a town where Thai ice tea flows freely, I think Regent Thai's is the best. You can never go wrong with their yellow curry or beef panang curry and their tom ga kai is rich and chock full of chicken. My kids could live on that soup. I can't remember the Thai name for it, but their yellow herbed rice dish with chicken, almonds and raisins is also very good. You don't find that dish at most Thai restaurants. I like that they serve pickled cucumbers, carrots and onions on the side. It adds to the presentation of the dishes as well as enhances the flavor of the meal. I should add that they are very kid friendly and most nights you will find neighborhood families dining here. If you go often enough and become a regular, they give you free dessert! Bring a kid and you'll always walk out with candy of some kind.
author: Kara P.

description: This is a great Thai restaurant. Portion is a bit small, but the quality of the dishes is high. I especially like their appetizers, a couple of nice chicken wing dishes. When you are in Noe Valley area, this is one of your best bets for Asian cuisine.
author: Charlie S.

description: great food. good portions, taste is right and prices are fair / reasonable - meaning that I pay for good tasting food with good portions when i'm hungry and go out to eat. I dont like to eat and leave hungry and find I just paid $$ for decor and nice table napkins with water served in a wine glass....Definitely a place for me, HIghly suggest Regent Thai ! Have their Pad Thai noodle. chicken wings and mango / rice dessert!
author: Edward B.

description: i love regent thai! i had never tried thai food before and was always kind of not sure of ever trying it. but once i came here, im glad i did! clean, neat, not too fancy, great good and great service. the shrimp plates are the best! everyone i know whos come here, ends up loving it.
author: vicki g.
